name: Amanda Brinkman
text: Terrible doctor wouldn't even try to help.

name: mickie g
text: Very professional, explains everything before it’s done and was kind. She has an awesome bedside manner. I was referred to her by chiropractor and after outpatient appointment I will definitely be using her for my back in the future.

name: Susie Reed
text: Cassie Burns is a wonderful person she's caring and loving and kind she'll help you as best she can.

name: Brian Lambert
text: Not happy about how she is handling my wife. What kind of doctor cuts off medications that a person has been on for 15 years without even seeing the patient first? VERY UPSET! My wife deserves better than this.

name: Jamie Cofield
text: I recently had surgery for getting the Boston Scientific stimulator. Dr Maddox and his team done an excellent job and im very happy with the results so far !

name: Caryn Hicks
text: Dr Maddox is a terrific Doctor. He makes me fill at ease when we talk to each other. He also makes me laugh. I would recommend Dr Maddox to anyone in need of a Pain Management physician. He really helped me.

name: Ericvalerie Nichols
text: Ok so I never had a PM doc before. I have PPO insurance so I'm thinking that I don't need any special docs. I went to the website it said book appointment  online. So I did. It said they will call be back for confirmation.  They didn't. So I call to make sure I had one. The old lady that answered the phone was rude to hell and back. I never wanted to cuss someone out so bad. I explained that the website said one thing and she's saying another. No need to be so freaking rude. I understand you have been sitting at that desk since moses but if you don't like your job retire. Also fix the website and be specific. You can not tell me that what I seen doesn't exist. Telling me know doesn't change the fact that it is there. Not to mention when you call it clearly says you can book appointments 24/7. So my review is about the rudeness of the 1920's switch board operator and the unclear non-specific instructions on the website and the phone message thingy. Point being retire or learn to be a people person. You get respect when you show respect.

name: Kelly Miller
text: I've used Maddox Pain Mgt for ten years and I am very pleased with the level of care I receive.  Dr. Maddox is dedicated to helping his patients HEAL rather than simply medicating them.  He researches and explores new medical procedures that will improve his patient's quality of life.  I was one of the first to get the spinal cord implant and more recently,  the revision to the most current technology.  I cannot adequately express how happy this device has made me.  My quality of life has been dramatically improved and the need for medication has been reduced to occasionally rather than daily.  The staff is super supportive and caring.  This is not your average pain management facility.  They don't want to just manage your pain,  they do their best to eliminate it and restore you to your best self.

name: Cynthia Mateo
text: Do ya really wanna know? I just fired him. Exactly he works for me and others. We choose the dr. Etc.

name: Brian Travis
text: Love this guy he is the most understanding pain management ive ever been to and listens actually listens to what ails you.

name: Andrea Kunert
text:
I am happy with Dr. Maddox and his staff. I will keeping seeing Dr. Maddox
as needed.
Andrea, September 19, 2018

name: scrawnymf
text: always get awesome care from support staff and Dr Maddox

name: Tara Wright
text: Customer service is awful.

name: Gene Helstrom
text: Dr Maddox and his staff have always treated me with respect and actually listened to me.

name: Churena Davis
text: I ❤️💖💕 Dr. Maddox & Staff!!!

name: Stephanie Diaz
text: All the staff here are friendly and knowledgeable. They have made my son very comfortable and are helping him alot.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We're always happy to hear that we've provided an exceptional experience for our patients. We wish you all the best!

name: Jimmy Reeves
text: My experience at Rehab has been wonderful. I’ve had 2 surgeries to recover from and thanks to Ray and his staff, my body is as strong as ever. They are extremely well organized and efficient. Every minute spent there is productive. The staff is friendly and professional and genuinely concerned about their patients. I highly recommend their service.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and entrusting your care to us. During this time, we are working harder than ever to continue providing the care you need while keeping you and our staff safe. We are happy to be here for you.

name: Kathy Walker
text: I have found the therapists to be personable, professional and knowledgeable.  I wholeheartedly recommend this facility for any of your therapy needs.

resp.text: Professional attitudes, compassion, trust and clinical expertise - that's what we promise to deliver. We're glad to hear that our staff's dedication to providing exceptional care and customer service managed to make your time in recovery that much easier. Thank you for your fantastic review.

name: Robyn Summerford
text: Excellent team. Great leadership

resp.text: It's always exciting to read such wonderful feedback. We love to hear that we are upholding our commitment to excellence. Thank you for entrusting us with your care, and remember, we're always here for you.

name: Barry Simmons
text: Very professional & knowledgeable  staff

resp.text: Our team always strives to offer the best service and we're glad to know we were a part of your recovery process. We appreciate the review and we wish you a speedy recovery!

name: Teresa Rachal
text: My 93 year old mom was there.  They are the most incompetent people I’ve ever met.  They do patient reviews to keep Medicare paying.  The patient reviews are not real.  They are all lies as to what a patient can do.  They should be investigated.

resp.text: Hi Teresa. Thank you for your feedback about your mother's experience. We're sorry to learn that you were unhappy with the care she received. It is our goal, every day, to provide exceptional clinical care and customer service experience to all of our patients. If you're interested in sharing more details, please consider sending an email to info@selectmedical.com so that we can review and reach out as appropriate. Thank you!

name: amanda jones
text: I cannot say enough amazing things about this place. From the time you walk in the door you're treated like family, my 4yr. old son excitedly skips in the door as if we were at Chunk E. Cheese. Jenn at the desk is always friendly, courteous and tries to accomadate all. Hannah, Anthony, and Matt are just a few therapist that will get you back feeling great again. So if you are looking to be treated like a friend rather than dollar signs then please call Jenn and she will take care of y'all. Rehab Associates Wetumpka is the is the best physical therapy business in central Alabama!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and entrusting your care to us. During this time, we are working harder than ever to continue providing the care you need while keeping you and our staff safe. We are happy to be here for you.

name: Dean Baskett
text: Outstanding treatment received by my wife and myself.  I would recommend this folks for your rehab. Anthony and his team were great!

resp.text: You needed care. We are grateful to be here for you. Thank you for entrusting your care to us to feel better and get back to life.

name: Keith lucy
text: The staff at Rehab Associates are some of the best that I have had the opportunity to work with. Great service to go along with great friendly personality is hard to find. At Rehab Associates you are guaranteed both.

name: Mary Hanby
text: The entire staff at Rehab Associates is first class. All of them are personable, caring and highly skilled at physical therapy. I’ll never go any place else!!

name: Doug Jones
text: Staff is awesome.   Since I started staff has worked for a common goal  to improve my well being.  Staff is friendly, courtesy, kind,and polite.  Strongly recommend this team for all your rehabilitation needs. Thank you for a job WELL DONE.

name: Virginia Hancock
text: The staff at Rehab Associates Wetumpka have all been dedicated to helping me recovery quickly from my knee replacement surgery. Since my first visit my therapy has been explained thoroughly, changed or adjusted as I improved, and they have encouraged me through the process. They are a great team of professionals dedicated to patient care. I highly recommend them and would come again if needed. Thank you!

name: Laura Berkstresser
text: Great place for pt! Friendly, knowledgeable people who are committed to helping you get well! My exercises could have left me tired and cranky, but the great community atmosphere kept my energy and my spirits high!

name: conbralius thomas
text: Professional and very knowledgeable personnel always has best  at heart for all patients .great family oriented atmosphere

name: Bob Mahoney
text: This organization is among the top 1% of the PT facilities in the Wetumpka, Tallassee, and Montgomery area.  If you are in need of any type of physical therapy and live in the area get you Physican to write the order for R. A. Hall’s facility in Tallassee.  Each and everyone of his personnel know their business, are right there to assist you and always do it with a smile.  Doesn’t make any difference whether is is 8:00 in the morning or 4:00 in the afternoon.

name: Barry Barnett
text: Complete rehab clinic. Very knowledgeable trainers, friendly staff. Always have time for your questions. Highly recommend them to anyone who needs rehab.

name: Johñ Henderson
text: The staff is respectable, professional, and friendly. The exercise room is always kept ln a clean condition.

name: G Greenfields
text: The ONLY place to go! The staff are always very friendly but professional. They will assist in a positive recovery.

name: Byron Searcy
text: I have been a patient at this facility on numerous occasions over the last several years as has my wife. We have found them to be nothing more than professional in what they do and also go out of their way to make sure we are given the proper treatment. Great atmosphere, great staff, clean surroundings! If I could rate them higher I would and if you need a rehab facility please don’t take my word for it go and try it for yourself. Trust me you you want regret it! Rehab Rocks! Byron and Beverly Searcy

name: shelby jones
text: Such wonderful, friendly and accompanying staff.

name: Larry Crawford
text: If the choice is yours to make, choose Rehab Associates in Wetumpka. Great staff and facility.

name: Diana Wood
text: Flexibility of scheduling, hospitality and experience of staff!

name: Debbie Nixon
text: Great Folks

name: shannon mcanalley
text: Very caring ! I am always treated like they care about my pain I would recommend them to anyone!

name: Karen Irazabal
text: I had my first appointment Since moving here from Wa State for chronic back pain.  I did have a prolonged wait time, however, being a retired RN myself I know dr’s have emergencies they sometimes have to take care of before routine visits, but once I was taken back into a room the nurse was friendly, and professional.  Dr Horne was amazing!  She spent time going through my history, previous CT scans and MRI’s, medications and made a plan for my care.  Set up appts for treatMets and future office appt.  Called in medications and made plans for some changes to help decrease my pain.  I was really anxious before seeing her but am now feeling like there is still hope for this old lady!

name: Brook Magee
text: They have been so nice. They really care what you say. I would recommend them to anyone

name: Lynette Burkey
text: I've been a patient for quite some time now and find Dr. Ballard and her staff to be attentive, compassionate and very professional. To me, being under the care of a pain specialist requires a special degree of trust in your doctor. I have complete confidence that Dr. Ballard has my best interest as her top priority, and her level of monitoring my progress and care gives me the peace I need. I would highly recommend her and her assistants should one require help with pain management. I take providing this level of recommendation very seriously and do not make these statements lightly.

name: Patrick Weeks
text: She’s been absolutely amazing during these trying times with my health. Her staff is absolutely off the charts!!! I was scared to death that she would run me off because of all the paperwork she was required to fill out. She has been by my side and has shown the upmost concern for my health. Her nurses couldn’t be anymore sweet than they are now!

name: Nancy Penque
text: A doctor that is dual board certified with academic experience, WOW!  The entire staff is genuine and warm and happy. Having a condition that causes multiple issues I was thrilled she is located in the hospital. A friend in the medical profession suggested her, that kind of endorsement is high praise.  Skilled and smart!  Thank you to the entire office for excelling at your jobs!

name: Lou Ethridge
text: I love her! She has really helped me! I would recommend her highly !

name: Krissy Cinnamon
text: I heard that National Doctors Day just passed. I can’t thank Dr. Gaylyn Horne Ballard enough for listening to me and helping me treat my chronic illness. I would not be walking today if it weren’t for her. I am treated with kindness and respect upon every visit and I’m so thankful for this doctor and her entire staff. I don’t know where I would be without them. THANK YOU FOR YOUR COMPASSION!!!

name: Susan Ensley
text: Finally, a pain management doctor that actually takes the time to sit and listen, to talk and to HELP. I am so thankful for the day I decided to make the change to Dr. Horne-Ballard's care. I have had my pain managed much better than ever before and I feel very secure in her techniques and recommendations. We are blessed to have her here in our town!

name: Doug Thompson
text: She cares nothing about helping anyone. All she wants to do is give worthless epidurals to bill your insurance huge amounts. Once you have the max allowed she will make up a reason to dismiss you. She flat out lied to my face and said my urine sample was not the right temperature. So I provided another as soon as requested. She lied again and said temp. was off. This was not true and she would not show me the bottle. Avoid her at all cost. She does not care about her patients.

name: steve cowan
text: Dr. Ballard has given me a quality of life back when no one else could. She doesn't give up. I thank God he led me to her!!!

name: Emily Harris
text: Refuses to work with patients when having hard times and really need the help. My husband can barely walk and you turn him away bc of some payment issues we are trying to work out from lapsed insurance, but the billing department won't answer the phone or return our calls. So how exactly are we suppose to resolce this issue? Some doctor. Really out to help people aren't you?? Sorry excuse for a human.

name: Lisa Beck
text: I would not take my dogs to her . They deserve better !  After she does all the epidurals she can to make the big money and then dismisses you as if you were nothing ! STAY AWAY !!

name: Lisa McIntosh
text: She has really helped me manage my pain.

name: Mel Mc
text: The first pain management docter that cares about me

name: Emily Townley
text: So UNPROFESSIONAL!!!... This is last place on earth I would go to for pain management! Then they had the nerve to flat out lie on my medical records, make a charge on my credit card without my permission on a day I wasn’t even in their office, and countless charges for “no show” fees for appointments that I didn’t even make! These people are HORRIBLE!!!

name: Jeremy Gossett
text: Great folks.  Highly recommend!

name: Patti Harvey
text: Because you take time and consideration for the patients .Thank You .

name: Steven Baird II (Woodsman)
text: Very carrying and a Superior Doctor,

name: patricia persons
text: Since being under Dr. Thoma's care for the past year and a half, I have felt better than I have in years.  I still have pain but it's manageable.  Friendly staff and Dr.  Thomas cares. He doesn't just dispense pills.

name: Denise Mayo
text: Dr Thoma has been my physician.for a number of years.  He is kind, smart, knowledgeable and an excellent physician!  He listens to you and takes time to answer all your questions!  He is exceptional!

name: Jeannine Hunter
text: The people here are so nice and understanding. They listen to what you have to say and do there best to help get pain under control so you can be your best. Thank you!

name: Amy Gargus
text: Dr. Thoma and his staff truly care about patient relief and although they are no a pill factory, they will do all they can legally and medically to help you. I have seen Dr. Thoma since 2005 and am sincerely a happy patient

name: Kelli Bryson
text: Dr. Thoma is very informative and extremely patient!  He thoroughly explained what was going on in my back.  He then proceeded to explain the steps that were needed to help with the pain.  Any time that I don't understand something he is very patient and thorough with his answer. Thank you Dr. Brian Thoma and Cahaba Pain and Spine Care ❤

name: Harvey Bowling
text: I've been coming to Dr. Thoma for years.  Great job, helped me better than anywhere I've been.!

name: Tomi Stronge
text: Dr. Thoma and the staff at Cahaba Pain and Spine center are very caring and concerned about my well-being and pain management.

name: Karen Johnston
text: I've been seeing Dr. Thoma for 2 year's now. Great Dr. and staff, always do there best to help in anyway they can.

name: Cindy Snider
text:
I have had nothing but positive experiences with every visit I have had. From the fro t staff, to the nurses, the nurse practitioners and finally with the physicians. I am met with friendliness, grace. Empathy and kindness and having been in back pain for many years that is very refreshing. I thank you. My staff is always willing to listen to any concerns and medicine changes and has done their best to accommodate me. Thank you Cahaba Spine and Pain Center. You have made my first visits with pain management must less intimidating and for all of your kindness and excellent treatment, I thank you.

Cindy Snider

name: Penny Torrence
text:
Dr Thoma is a God send to me.  I came to Cahaba Spine and Pain Care in March of 2017. I've had many procedures and Dr. Thoma has truly listened to me with compassion and understanding. Days and nights were miserable before coming here for my back problems. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
Love and prayers,
Penny Grimes

name: Darlene Raughton
text:
I have been going to Dr Thoma for about a year and a half.  I am so proud to finally find a pain management doctor that really wants to help you!  He really cares about his patients.  He wants to make you better, not just dispense a pill.  He is not  just in it for the money.
His staff is very nice and always helpful.
I have referred many of my friends to him and all have said he is wonderful.  Thank you Dr. Thoma!

name: Dianna McLain
text: Staff is very caring and gives good information I need. Wait time is reasonable.

name: Harper Symone
text:
I never made it to the appointment due to Dr. Thoma having his staff call me MULTIPLE times days before my appointment and the day of the appointment to reschedule. The day of the appointment, his staff claimed he “ was not feeling well” and needed to go home. However, several days before his staff called asking me to change my appointment.

Did he know he was going to get sick before he got sick? I don’t think so. I think his staff scheduled me on a day he had other plans and instead of sucking it up and doing his job he INCONVENIENCED me.

I ended up getting a bad feeling about him and not going. Waste of time and questionable ethical standards.

name: Larry Wolfe
text: If you have a negative experience here, as some have commented, you MUST be doing something wrong.  I started seeing Dr Thoma and the staff at Cahaba Pain and Spine several months ago, and ALL my experiences have been extraordinarily positive.  Every single person at their office has been courteous, friendly, professional, and thorough.  And nobody ever seems to be in a rush -- they always take the time to make sure I'm comfortable and have all my questions answered.   And Dr Thoma and staff DO make every effort to help control my pain.  These folks are the best. Period.

name: Mike Riley
text: Please if you have pain and need a place to go you cant go wrong at Cahaba Pain and Spin. The stay is great. I get treated with respect and im not just a number. When i needed an aswer for my pain.  God sent me here. And here ive gotten the treatment i need. Ive been to the rest now come to the best. I love the doctors and staff.  So glad to have them in my life

name: JiJi Brea
text: If you are young and have medical problems and actually need your medicine don’t go to this doctor, he will lie to you and take you off your medicine and refuse to give you anything. I’ve been through hell to get where I am now with my health and will not be treated like a drug addicted. I’ve never been in this situation and it has been a horrible experience!!

name: Tina Little
text: My husband was sent here from the VA in Birmingham he has had pain for a while .Dr Thoma pin pointed the spot and has started injections and has helped him so much with his pain.

name: Carlene Hannah
text: I have been with Southern Wellness for many years. If your looking for a pain managment office with caring people you should call this one. From the front desk to the nurses. Dr.Beenken is awesome in my book.

name: J P
text:
Want to say thank you in so many ways. From the super friendly front desk to the efficient nurses in the back, all went above and beyond to help me. The doctor is very strict as he should be but I can tell he actually cares too. Thank you so much for everything. -
A very private nurse 😉

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review. We strive to treat our patients to the best of our abilities!

name: Jamie Dorsett
text:
I honestly do not even know where to begin.. from the sweet sweet lady at the front desk, to the nurses in back , and to the doc, who yet strict..(which I genuinely appreciate) were all so very  caring and  thorough! I have been suffering from the result of 8 too many back surgeries .. and I want to Thank you all for the respect and dignity shown by each of you ! You will never know how much it means to someone in chronic pain, to have people who take the time to listen and who truly care !! God intervened in a BIG way by sending me to your practice  .. I am truly blessed and forever grateful !! And I pray abundant blessings over each and every one of you !!
Once again .. thank you all SO very much !!!

Jamie lyn

name: jonothan english
text: My wife has been in severe pain due to her back. This clinic is very professional. I am very impressed with the professionalism and the Dr actually seems to care about his patients and he actually spends time with his patients. This is a great place to go if you have real problems and need help.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! We are in this business to help our patients and we attempt to schedule our patients to allow for enough time to address concerns.

name: Jimmy Webster
text: This was my first visit. I read the reviews not very good. I walked in it was crowded. My experience with the staff and doctor was awesome. Polite and very helpful. The only problem I saw was patient being out of line. She wasn't getting her way. You have that everywhere. I was very pleased with my visit.

name: Linda Ann Reynolds, Ed.S.
text:
Ryan Almeda is sorely lacking in many areas.  He is rude, makes poor judgments regarding proper management of pain. Books too many appointments per day. Staff behavior is as unstable as he is since they are under his direction.  Staff Yells at patients, falsely accuses patients. Urine tests are not properly screened allowing for fake urine samples. Witnesses have observed to this incompetence.
DO NO NO HARM Almeda, or stop.
KARMA.

name: Carlos McDaniel
text: I am 72 years old and was a patient of Dr. Casy Long. I have a degenerative disc disease and the lower back pain and another mri showed in my neck.Dr. Long had my pain pretty stable. Dr. Alameda took his place and my last visit cut my meds back. The pain started growing again. My wife and I are in quarantine with COVID and I called fir a telephone visit and got denied. I told them I was out of my meds but it didn’t matter to them. I was told I would have to come in. If they don’t care anymore than that for the people then I will find another. If he got to this kind of pain at this age he would see how his patient felt.

name: Pat Felder-Cato
text: There's usually a long waiting time, even with an appointment. The entire time in the office was  less than an hour on my last visit! That's only happened once before in the four years I've been doing there.  The three stars are for seeing  N P., not the doctor !!

name: Cynthia Mann
text: Great staff

name: Carey Frasier
text: Doctor Shikh is amoung the best. He is perfeshional and understanding.  His staff is kind and courteous at all times. I would highly recommend his clinic.  He does not push pain meds, he wants to treat the cause.

name: Ginger Foote
text: I have used Dr. Shikh for over a year now.  My experience is always pleasant as everyone in the office is caring and courteous.  My condition doesn't  "fit" in the box, as some of my symptoms are somewhat bizarre.  He always listens and offers solutions.  Have never felt rushed, as he is very thorough with questions and examination. Always patient to answer my questions.

name: David Ross
text: So rude staff

name: candy cane
text: If possible find another pain management Dr. This Dr. Will have you so dependant on pain meds and without warning take you off....claiming that the pain med itself is causing your pain ....even though he's got mri results in your med records showing herniated disc and degenerative disc disease. I've been thru pure H*** for months now I have a wonderful Dr. I literally have nightmares about Dr Shikh.

name: Johnathan Quinn
text:
Dr Burke and his team are amazing. They were the reason that I was able to keep both of my feet. I cannot thank them enough. When I read through the negative posts you can almost tell that those were only looking for drugs.
Thank you all again!

name: Justin Archer
text: DR.McKinght this man told my family doctor not to give me anymore pain meds! why?  He did not tell me that he was going to tell me doctor that. I have been on chemotherapy drugs and others for an auto immune disease that causes me to lose my Job. I went to this men for help I was very open with him about have pain meds. I told him why I was there. All he saw was a young man looking for drugs. I have never OD or been addicted to them. Don’t even waste your time with him. He made me out to be a seeker.  I understand I’m young but this is not ok. I hope y’all listen to me especially if your young. FYI they have a clinic in Cullman on Fridays.

name: Janet
text: The Staff is always polite ,the only one drawback is sometimes there backed up and you have to wait a little longer. But truly they give you the one on one  attention.I have been with them now for about 5 or 6 years. (. ❛ ᴗ ❛.) I hope this is helpful to you if your trying to find a great place to decided if you want to use them .

name: B Teem
text:
Dr Kendrick is not only kind and caring, he is a very knowledgeable doctor.
He runs a tight ship.  If anyone thinks they can get over on him, they do not need to make the first appointment.

Yes people have to be screened for drugs.
I would never consider going anywhere else.

name: vicki brown
text:
Never had problems with clinic. Dr K took time to go over my issues and then explain in detail procedures necessary and why.
Mariana and Conner very thorough.  X-ray tech showed me my X-ray and explained exact issue also.

name: Donna Potts
text: Dr. Kendrick is wonderful. All of the staff is extremely nice and professional. I highly recommend all of the doctors and medical staff here. My only suggestion would be for us not to have such a long wait to be seen.

name: Lynn Duvall
text: You can tell a lot about how you’ll be treated by a business by the way the receptionist/gatekeeper treats you. Without knowing anything about me, the woman here (Rachel) assumed I would only be coming to the clinic to get opioids and she treated me accordingly.  I tried SS Pain about 6 years ago and was considering returning because the clinic I like is 30 minutes away, a challenging journey for me right now. (SS Pain is only a few blocks away.) Despite the fact that my treatment there had been abysmal. Doc who saw me changed all my medication and that decision left me traumatized for a month. I was barely able to function and spent that month confined to a chair. I sent numerous frantic messages about my debilitated condition but they were ignored. During my follow up the nurse practitioner seemed more interested in the fact that I had lost 25 pounds (because I wasn’t able to cook for myself) than in the month I spent feeling miserable and in pain. For the past 35 years I have suffered pretty constant pain from fibromyalgia and degenerative disc disease and I’ve seen some mediocre providers. SS Pain was the worst. Even so, I was about to give them another chance. If Rachel hadn’t talked to me like a drug-seeking addict, reminding me exactly how painful my experience was there, I might have gone back.

name: Adam Forrester
text:
Well, Yesterday was my first visit and I just wanted to say that Every Single Employee I came in contact was Professional and kind. Not exactly sure why some people left bad reviews. One think people need to understand is You get what you Give. If You talk or act rude or mean to others you get the same in return.
The Golden Rule. (Do Unto others as you would have them do unto you). Once again. Thanks for a wonderful experience.

name: Philip Whitt
text: They are always there to help you when you need them. And you NEVER have to wait all day to be seen . These negative post are obviously not familiar with the way that pain clinics are ran. I've been to two different ones and this one is by far the best one ever. They are the nicest staff and most professional group that I have ever been to. They're always trying to help you figure out  the best way to treat your pain. When something new comes along they're always on top of it.

name: Taylor Harper
text: This place is a joke. It's a pain clinic that doesn't treat pain. If you don't want shots or an electric shocker in your spine they won't help you. Dr Kendrick will not listen to you and he will not help your pain. He will only argue with you and say he doesn't believe your in pain. Do not seek help from this place because you won't find it here especially if you are under workman's comp. He is more worried about prescription costs and saving workman's comp money than he is your pain. He is a horrible doctor.

name: arlesha p
text: Must admit I was very Hesitant about this place that my primary doctor referred me to because of all the negative reviews and how badly people were talking about the doctors and staff. I went in my appointment expecting horrible bedside manner, horrible nurses, etc. Well I must say none of that happened. Dr.Berek and his nurse Johnathan were amazing. They actually listened to what my concerns were and let me explain what I need to be done and how we can achieve pain- free days. I have to give a big thanks to everyone that I encountered today , you guys are doing very well on customer service !

name: Myra Dudzinski
text: Never will answer the phone or return my calls and when you go for an appointment be prepared to stay there for several hours

name: Patrick Michael
text: I urge everyone to avoid this clinic. My first appointment was at 1:30 and we didn't leave until almost 6PM. On my second visit, I saw an NP who took it upon himself to change my treatment protocol without consulting my physician. Also, he was more than willing to share his personal 'beliefs' about certain aspects of care not under the clinic's supervision. He was very quick to cast blame instead of listening and working collaboratively. I was placed on a medication which after a month was making me worse by the physicians own admission. Then, I had to go through the process of going off the medication. Most recently, a clinical assistant who I had never seen listened-in on a private conversation I was having with another patient. She took it upon herself to scold me for something she didn't like--much like what we see in the extreme leftist movement sweeping the nation--and told me I couldn't say what I was saying in the office. I wasn't threatening anyone or using profanity, so this was in direct violation of my first amendment rights. Then, she talked to me as if I were a child. Again, no one I had ever seen before who knew nothing about my treatment OR the fact I cannot de-escalate hostility and can react with extreme rage. Lastly, I was told that if I didn't start an obscure psychological treatment, I would be kicked out of the clinic. This assumes I can find said treatment and can afford said treatment.

name: Peggy
text: Dr Burke is the best doctor! Phones are answered now, staff very nice and responsive

name: Bullet Brown
text:
At almost 50, I have seen many doctors and clinics through the years. But, over the last 9 months I have visited clinics and hospitals on a weekly basis...this is hands down the WORST clinic I have even been too.

Patients are treated as if they are drug addicts...even when the service they are performing involves no drugs, With a referral from my doctor, a diagnosis of complex regional pain syndrome, AND exposed bone, tendons, and ligaments in my foot they wanted me to have a psych evaluation...to be sure my pain is "real". It is not only insulting, but allows them to continue to drag an already extremely painful situation out even more. Have a look at the photo below and you realize that it doesn't take a brain surgeon...or in this case a "pain specialist" to see that this is painful and serious

The two sympathetic nerve blocks to close down the nerve to my foot were not only failures, they pain intensified even MORE. The staff  have zero patience with you, rude attitudes, and cannot keep your information organized & correct. The Nurse told us one thing, thena doctor we assumed was Kendricks (turns it it wasn't even him and I have no idea who the man even was!) comes in and tells us something else. This is why people do not trust doctors.

I would recommend this clinic to no one...please have your doctor refer you somewhere that can provide you the necessary care in a professional and timely manner.

Wow....I Also just discovered by going to their website and looking at bio photos that Dr. Kendricks was not even the doctor who saw us in the exam room!...and we don't even see the 'doctor who did! Regardless, these doctors are supposed to be "pain specialists"...yet they have NO true concept of pain...do not trust them!

name: Scott York
text: They do not care anything about trying to help you.  The wait is usally 2 to 3 hours. They will call you and if you dont answer the phone they will send you a letter stating they can not see you anymore. This is one of the worst doctors office I have ever been to before.

name: Norma Lilly
text: Thorough

name: Robert Hooper
text:
Well all I can say is good luck with this bunch. I have lung cancer . My lung cancer Drs tried to call them. But left there# for Southside to call

. They never called and I'm miserable. They have never control my pain but maybe a week since January.
I call them and was already in Birmingham so I stopped by to asked them what there plan was?
I was told that I had to have an appointment to leave a message. I'm beginning to think we need to call the authority s an call for them to be drug tested.
I'm about to get fed up. I hate eveyone and I've been in so much pain everyone hates me and I hate myself for feeling like this. I mean come on. Do something even if it's wrong

name: Grandpa Bear
text: The doctors do a good job with the procedures and the office staff is good WHILE YOU THERE. They do NOT answer their phones and do not return calls. They charge $50 for missed appointments but refuse to communicate with you. Everyone has to leave voice mails. Sometimes they will call you if you leave a detailed message on the portal. Recently had to change appointment because of family emergency and it took me five days to get them to answer —on the day of the appointment— and the business manager is “to important “ to talk to patient’s concerns. I have an upcoming appointment and tried to confirm via their email link — McAfee wouldn’t let me because of security issues and I’m told they will cancel if I don’t confirm. And forget about emergency treatment. The closest you can hope for is a 1 - 2 day response to the portal. If they would hire someone to answer the phones that could actually answer questions and make/change appointments it might become a patient centered practice.

name: Greg Wallace
text: Had an appointment today but did not go because all the negative reviews. Can't believe that my work comp was going to send me to a place like this. Will be contacting them in the morning! Plus I asked for a Thursday appointment and somehow they gave me a Wednesday, didn't realize it until a couple days ago!

name: Tracie Hayes
text: I have brought a family member here and these people are terrible! Why do people get treated as drug addicts when I do know for a fact they are not! This is truly ridiculous... When she has a specialist telling her not to take medicines they are trying to force her to take.... But refuse to call the specialist themselves! I wouldn't recommend this place for no one

name: Sandra Oberg
text: I've been a patient here for about five years.  Most of the time I have to go back for another injection because the first one doesn't help at all.  No one will answer the office phone, and no one will return a call when I leave a message.  I really like the doctors and staff but they need to be more mindful of others.

name: Michael J. Glasheen
text: Very nice clinic. Fast and friendly staff and doctors

name: Rose Burgess
text: I have been a patient at this clinic a year now.  When I called to make an appointment to get my medication, I was told that I will not be seen for treatment until my arrears are paid down to less than 100 dollars.  I am just not sure what to do except to post this.

name: Timmy Hooper
text: They just treat you as another number. Treat your condition the same as the next patient.  Dont care about your daily life or activities you cant enjoy any longer. They dont take what you say into consideration.  Its their way or nothing. I dont recommend this place unless its your only option. You see a different nurse practitioner (never the actual doctor) and each nurse practitioner has their own set in their ways how they want your treatment to go. Its never consistent and most act as if you dont need to be there and im in a wheelchair for heavenz sake with multiple fractures. FIND A DIFFERENT PLACE if you want better care( i did btw leave on my own terms) update April 2019

name: Patricia Berry
text:
This is my third visit to this clinic. My first visit took 21/2 hours. my second visit took 2 hours. My third visit which is today March 26, 2019 was at 1:40 pm I checked in at 1 pm. I sat in the lobby for 2hours and 50 minutes. When I arrived, my pain was around 2 or 3 now my pain is at a 7. This is the worst services I have every encountered. Dr. Goynes is the doctor I see.
My first visit she did not want to give me any pain meds. She tried to convince me that my pain was merely nerve pain; therefore, she tried to give me gabapentin, lyrical, and Cymbalta. I explain to her that each of these meds make me feel out of myself. So, she finally gave me 15 Norco 5-325.
My second visit, she read my MRI and she focused only on the nerves again. Therefore, she tried to give me gabapentin, lyrical, and Cymbalta again. I explain to her again that each of these meds make me feel out of myself. She said she don’t think she and I are going to workout as doctor and patient because I don’t want to take any of the meds she was prescribing. I ask her do she want me to take medications that I am allergic to? She no, but she was not big on giving opioids ’in concern that I might get addicted to them later on down the road. I have never used any street drugs, I do not drink alcohol, all my drug screens are negative. This will be my last visit at SPS, I am in process of switching to a different clinic. I am not going to say don’t go here because every person is different. This place may work well for others but it is not the place for me.

name: Tim Brannon
text:
I'm shocked at the negative reviews. My wife has been going here for over 2 years and has only been treated with respect and kindness.
On her last visit she had a terrible migraine and Dr. Lumsden went out of his way to offer her help. He doesn't even treat her for her migraines.
Listening to her describe some places she had tried prior to this place, it sounds very PROFFESIONAL compared to the others.

name: John Foster
text: I've called twice two days in a row to reschedule an appointment and got their voicemail. I did not have to choose them but I will start looking for something better. They should not overbook and have people waiting. ENOUGH!!

name: nancy penque
text: Dr. McCabe is excellent.  Listens, thorough exam, offers many different options for help.  Couldn't have asked for better care or a more caring staff!!

name: Katherine “Katie” Giattina
text:
Don't go here if think you're going to get anything you ask for or anything you want or basically anything that you actually need
As a matter of fact if you fax your records I think they put them in a paper shredder.
Good luck!

name: jasmine hughes
text: Office staff are good,  but the Doctors are the rude , judgemental and don't care about trying out help you. If you have a choice go somewhere else . Read through these reveiws wish I would have first.

name: Donna Rudolph
text: My mother goes here and we have called and left messages for her appointment time and date (because we didn't get a call to remind us of the appointment) no one call back we needed to know in a head of time due to us having to call the fire Dept to get her out of the house. We have to let them know three days in advance. So when you all do decide to call back it's too late.

name: JDoty killingsworth
text: I was referred to Dr Goyne but ended uo with Dr Fulmer.  Her PA,  male spent more time and really getting to know me and while I was there. No return calls and she was aloof and uncaring.  I was there for the pain. I have since been hospitalized 2 times and 20 weeks of IV antibiotics for osteomyelitis and lost part of my right foot.  I was very disappointed and discouraged,

name: Craig Hathcock
text: I am one of those people who read reviews and assume it’s not that bad, well let me tell you: On October the 10th 2017 I had an appointment that I had been waiting for a month for. I needed an epidural for my lumbar spine (I hate taking pain meds). I had seen several doctors including an ER Dr. who all said the same thing—get an epidural. So on the day of my appointment my wife drives me to the VA hospital and I decide to walk to the clinic (walking is good for your back). This clinic is located in one of Birmingham’s housing projects filled with abandoned homes, halfway houses, thugs, and free range pit bulls. I show up to my 1PM appointment at 1130 knowing I will have paperwork to do. I wait until 1:30 before I am called back for a urinalysis and then promptly sent back out to the waiting room to continue waiting. This the closest I have ever felt to being a prison inmate. Apparently pain clinics are only for people who abuse medications—at least, that’s how you are treated. The new patient packet was thick and asked a lot of questions, when the “nurse”? Finally called me back she took my height and weight then asked me all the questions again (what a waste of time). Finally the Dr. comes in for 5 minutes give or take, tells me I have a screwed up back and that I should get an epidural..... then I’m taken out to get everything scheduled for 3 epidurals over three months and an 8 week follow up. The first thing they could get me was 2 weeks later on the 24th. For the second epidural I tell the young lady that I would like to do the follow up on the same day, I have a 2 hour drive (one way) to get there and take off work. Now, I’m no rocket scientist but 2 months is 8 weeks. I am told for insurance purposes they can’t do both on the same day.(aka they can’t bill me twice if I do it on the same day). Then I overhear the receptionists telling each other that they can’t tell people that the billing company is in Texas..... They now have to say it’s an outside company. All said and done this was hands-down the worst experience I have had (and I fought in two wars). I was made to feel like a criminal, had to wait a long time, ended up in a super bad area of town, was blatantly told they are gonna charge my insurance as much as possible even if it inconveniences me. They pushed full anesthesia instead of a local anesthetic which is the normal (assuming to squeeze my insurance for more money), and then instructing other employees to lie to customers. If you need something go so somewhere else.

name: sandra lynn
text:
GO SOMEWHERE ELSE
I just got off the phone with Morgan and as usual no answers to any of my questions. I thought when I met Dr. Goyne I thought I had found the doctor I had always looking for, boy was I wrong. On my second visit  she cut my pain medicine in half and then I get a call that she is not going to give me medicine anymore without a reason .I feel I deserve a reason. Morgan always calls and so rude, she dont want to give me my pain pills but schedule a block for this week. I dont understand after being on this medication for 7 years from a bad car accident how she can just decide I dont need my medicine anymore but I need a pain block. Back to the charges they charge 200 per drug screen and $70 dollars everytime you fill out that tablet. I have decided to go to a suboxin  clinic and try to get off this medicine, I am tired of these doctor's thinking they are God and we are drug addicts. I didn't ask to get hit by a drunk driver.By the way I am not confused about anything I promise this practice will come to a halt, I am contacting everyone that is anyone, I understand the pricing etc! what I don't understand is how a doctor on the first visit makes you feel important and that she is going to help me and she did give me hope for the first time in years. On my first visit I told her I had been a marijuana smoker for 40 years and I had quit on 7-29-18 and seen Dr. Goyne on 8-21-18. I knew my drug test would come back dirty as it had not even been 30 days, she replied I don't usually write a prescription when a drug test is dirty but I believe you. My second visit on 9-19-18 my test was still dirty we looked it up and for a long term smoker it can take up to 100 days to get out of your fat cells. She then gave me half of my pain medication and was a complete doctor of which I first met. She made my next appointment for 11-3-18 to ensure I would be clean, upon checkout the girl called to ask about my prescription lapse and she was told that on the 19th I could pick up a prescription to last me till 11-3-18, Dr. Goyne assured me once my test came back clean she would resume my medication. After I get a call to go take a MRI which I did, the I was called to schedule a block, but at the same time I was told Dr. Goyne was not going to write me anymore pain meds and she called me in a prescription for withdraws and it cost $2200 hundred dollars. Insane, I have taken this medication since 2011 date of my auto accident, and this doctor takes a oath to do no harm which is exactly what she is done to me. She has lied promising she would resume my medication, and that i could pick up the prescription for the 10-20 to 11-03-18,, with no regards on how sick i am and how much worse it is going to be. Withdraw medication does not help with my injuries and the pain I live in. I am aware of your cost which are insane, I know this from my insurance company. So If i live thru this at my age after 7 years of use I will make it my mission to expose this company.
Sandra Pruitt

name: Annie Martinez
text: First off, the nurse that took my blood pressure took 10 min to get a reading and in turn, my arm went numb from how tight the cuff was. Secondly, I saw a total of 2 nurses and 2 doctors... why is that necessary? I've been going for 2 years for the same issue, nothing has changed so all that mess was unnecessary. Oh and don't expect to ever get anyone on the phone or anyone to call you back when you leave them a message. I've been calling for 3 weeks because they charged me $200 for a drug screen and $80 for all the physicians I saw when I have BCBS and paid a copay! Bunch of money hungry fools here.

name: Blake Dempsey
text: Wow.  If you have an eternity to make phone calls and try to navigate their broken phone system, this is the place for you.  Just called four times straight and was disconnected each time, with each extension being 'invalid.'  When I was in a few months ago, they said ... "Oh yeah, the voice mail doesn't work.  Just keep calling until you get someone."  Because we all have lots of extra time to use inefficiently.  How on earth they stay open is a miracle.

name: Stephaine Jones
text: Hi my name is Sherrie I give them a 5 star inspite of what Dr Tai staff lied about  the doctor was caring he listen the staff in Jasper Al awesome I'll be coming back

name: Ryan Files
text: Great business! Great doctors! I would highly recommend visiting Southside Pain Specialists.

name: William Howard
text: I have been going here for a few years and they have always been so nice and respectful of my problems and very helpful to get to the problem of my pain.

name: Caron Kendrick
text: Most courteous staff and thorough evaluation.  I am so much better!

name: joe cox
text:
My opinion of the service here can be described in one word-TERRIBLE. Advised to go to this place after neck surgery. From the start the nurse that called us back, Lauren, was incredibly rude and unprofessional. She was the rudest person I have ever met in the medical field. Ordered to give urine sample, so I politely asked to see the dr first. So she said "if you don't have anything to hide I should WANT to give a sample". After her belittling us for the next 15 minutes we saw Goyne. No help what so ever. These Drs are strictly pill pushers in my opinion, not helping to find the cause of problem, just prescribing narcotics and off to the next room. I don't know if all pain clinics are like this, but I would stay away from this one. Overall lacking in cleanliness and patient care is non existent. Strictly a place to get prescription pain pills is primarily what they are used for. Not much of "practicing medicine". Oh and if you have a question for Goyne, forget it. She has no time. She's off to the next room to deal more prescriptions. Try another place. Any other place!

I see where the response of my post from the clinic is for me to call them because customer satisfaction is a high priority. I don't think the office realizes I called twice to speak to Dr Goyne. Left my number. She NEVER returned my call and weeks later had someone in the front (receptionist maybe) call me back and suggested I come back and talk on next visit. I told them again I had couple concerns/questions I would like to ask Goyne before my next visit. Never heard back. But it’s only been several months so maybe they’ll call me one day. A joke. No reason to treat anyone the way we were treated. I sincerely hope the people reading this that actually need help find somewhere else to go. We wasted too much time.

name: Jeremy McDonald
text: There's a reason they have a 2.9 rating.My girlfriend went out of the state done everything right and was told there would be no problem filling the script at wal-mart.But since being out of town the local wal mart had to have confirmation from the Dr. to fill.She left messages to Southside pain and so did the wal mart finally got a call three days later where the called wal mart to approve the meds,while the whole time she stayed sick and in pain.Do yourself a favor and go with someone else,very unprofessional Doctors who just want their fee.

name: wendy bivins
text: I love Dr Goyne but I have NEVER waited less than an hour and a half  to see someone and the receptionist never answers the phone. Love the Dr hate the office.

name: sandra goggins
text:
On my last visit, a prescription refill that is normally send directly to my pharmacy, wasn't sent. I have left 2 voicemails, one refill request and the pharmacy sent a fax requesting a refill. Still NOTHING. My pain is on it's own time not Southside Pain Specialist's time. I'm considering asking my primary care Physician to refer me to another pain management facility.

Sandra Myrick
April 20, 2016

name: Nicole Greer
text:
Absolutely LOVE Dr. Kendrick and his CRNP Rickey. They are truly two of the most knowledgeable medical professionals in the chronic pain field. Patient questions and concerns are thoroughly listened to and addressed at each visit. An insurance change caused me to have to leave a different reputable pain mgmt practice, and seek out a new Dr. Being extremely pleased at the other clinic, I searched for somewhere that I hoped would at least be close to as good(I decided that "tolerable" would work for the time being). I found Southside PS and gave it a shot. I liked Dr. Kendrick, but felt like some of the staff members back then (SEVERAL years back)viewed me as another drug seeker. I held on, tried to understand what they dealt with on a daily basis and decided to give it some time. One of the best decisions I've ever made!! It wasn't too long before I started noticing that those particular staff members weren't there and they were replaced with helpful and caring individuals who treated patients the way that we all would like to be treated. Dr. Kendrick is awesome, but his CRNP's make it to where he can do what he's actually there to do, and they handle the rest. Rickey and Stephanie have both gone above and beyond to help me with any issues that I may have, as well as ensuring that I do what I'm supposed to be doing in order to get the maximum benefit from my treatment. I came to them on certain medications that I had been taking for a while. I knew that upping the dose could be dangerous as well produce more issues down the road, given my relatively young age. I explained the issues that I was having to Rickey, and with my answer to a single question, he was able to remedy the situation... Without changing med, dose amount, or frequency! It was an extremely simple solution; however, not being a medical professional myself, it was not anything that I would have ever figured out/thought of on my own. The pharmacology associated with how the body distributes and metabolizes certain meds, is foreign to me. I am ever so thankful to Dr. Kendrick and his staff for helping me be the wife/mother/employee that I am today! With only 1-2 minor exceptions(and it's not every appt), I feel cared for and respected from the moment I sign in, until I walk out the door to leave.
As others have mentioned, it is difficult to reach them via phone. They have a solution for that too, that's extremely easy and convenient - Patient Portal. Just create your account, and you're set. I use it as my primary means of communication with the office. You pick your doctor's name, type of issue/question you have, and then start typing out the explanation or ask your question. There may have been 1-2 times that it's required a call back to me, but the overwhelming majority of the time, they are able to just "email" a response through my portal account. This is not  ideal for TRUE MEDICAL EMERGENCIES, thus the 911 system. A question or request can still be important and/or time sensitive, and not meet criteria for Emergency status, in which case, the only thing to do is send or leave a message and wait for the response. This may be an inconvenience to some, but I personally love that they've provided patients with an alternative way to contact them!
(*This is not a "pill mill" so anyone who's just looking for a Dr who will write whatever prescription you ask for in mass quantities, needs to keep searching!)

name: teresa hall
text:
My husband and I started going here because our local doctor retired and there weren't any others to see in our area. Dr. Fulmer was assigned to both of us.  We were both unhappy at first.  I didn't want a block but she was adamant I needed to try it.  I did get it
and it didn't do anything for me. Switched meds several times and went thru misery.  I also felt like Dr. Fulmer didn't have a good "bedside manner", but I now realize she was just being cautious and trying to get to know us the same as us getting to know her. She tries to find the best med that will work for you as an individual, instead of just putting you on strong meds.  She is very sweet and willing to answer any questions when we see her. The "extra" staff you see before you see the doctor is just to help speed up the process which I am grateful for because you don't sit in the waiting room all day.  We are usually seen very quickly when we go. My only complaint, as I see in other reviews, is also trying to get someone on the phone.  If you have to speak to a nurse you have to leave a message and recording says if call is before 3 p.m. you will get a call back same day.  I have never been called back the same day, usually 2 or 3 days.  I would think the recording needs to be changed or have more staff to answer calls.  But overall now happy with our care.

name: cb61998a
text:
Didn't notify me of needing an insurance referral until I arrived, had to reschedule appt for a later date. Was told at 1st appt date if I wanted to be seen on original date I could pay "X" amt for office visit & "X" amt for drug tests.
Came back for 2nd/rescheduled appt-still no referral in hand-paid the "X" amt-that I was AGAIN told was the office visit amt & the "X" amt was still the same for the drug testing but could be paid separately-by the next office visit. My 23yr old daughter was there to hear this convo BOTH times. Paid office visit, got reciept.
Next month come in-I owed extra for the previous office visit which had doubled the previous quoted "X" amount & so had the drug testing amount. Doubled.
I left out & didn't even bother making a follow up visit after I finished that days appt. Just left.
They also lied to me on that last visit but it's just too lengthy to get into on top of all of this.
Do not have good business or office practices (manners).

name: Stephanie Sewell
text: Had a block done by Dr Ashley Fulmer and was the worst experience ever. Laid on by tummy and cried for a week in pain that would not stop still had to go to ER for relief. Tried calling the office and they wanted me to come in, pay yet another copay to see if the nurse practitioner could see anything wrong. SERIOUSLY? !?!

name: cheryl king
text: The doctor has took me off my meds and now I'm in serious danger. The worst doctor ever. DR AMY FULMER.

name: johnnye crowell
text: Had a procedure on Monday. Called three times and left messages no one has called me yet and today is Saturday.

name: Melanie Bryson
text: Very unprofessional!! I've been calling for 2 days now trying to get set up on payments. No one will call me back. The receptionist there will not let me talk to a supervisor I get voicemail again. Worse company I've ever dealt with!!

name: Ashley Carpenter
text: Worst pain clinic ever first off waiting room and parking lot extremely small people at the front desk always on the phone but never answer when I call the doctors treat you so badly this one in particular Ashley fulmer she doesn't listen very judgemental how can you tell a person how much pain they are experiencing or how much pain they have experienced just because your a doctor doesn't mean you no it all you can be wrong too I wouldn't recommend a dog to come let alone a human being worst pain clinic ever👎👎👎👎👎

name: Nathan Yates
text: The doctor and staff were professional and I would recommend them highly!

name: Janet DeWilde
text: My block was okay but I didn't think the staff was very friendly. Viva has also turned down my request a another block in a different place . I'm not happy with my Drs. move to downtown Birmingham. I have to have a driver to get that far.

name: Lee Brown
text: Very nice and very helpful

name: Alexa Frye
text: Doctor Amy fulmer, is not a good doctor. Doesn't listen,doesn't care. Go to another pain doctor for help.

name: Brian Wiginton

name: Jim
text: Great doctors and staff!

name: Chuck Adams
text: Very professional staff -- highly recommend Southside Pain Specialists!

name: Johnny Wester
text: Too much automated phone system

name: Judina Boos
text: Excellent care

name: jamie Mcneely
text: A great place to go if you love pain. They take your money and come up with excuses on way they won't help you.

name: Helen Hall
text: This place is horriable I was 10mins late I have a broken leg and was turned away bc I was 10mins late..find somewhere else to go!!!

name: Carol Leigh
text: I was referred by Baldwin bone and joint. It’s been three weeks and after several phone call to this office and my insurance company I still don’t have anything done. The person on the phone says yes we have the information from Bone and joint but no one here has submitted it to get the ok from your insurance I will do it today. That was 2 weeks ago. My ins co still has not heard from them!!!!! Keep in mind this was for an injection for extreme pain from 3 weeks ago. I would never go to the they are incompetent. The doctors may be good but the office is horrible.Good way to ruin a practice!

name: Mario Gabriel JR.
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Barfield at Comprehensive Pain and Rehab for just over a year. I’ve had assessments, injections and radio frequency ablation. All treatment has been progressive and very effective. Dr. Barfield is extremely knowledgeable, caring and has a very pleasant personality. Ms. Felicia, the nurse assigned to work on my case is also always extremely pleasant, friendly and always displays a caring attitude. The front admin section staff is equally friendly and very timely competent. All in all, a practice worthy of a visit and trust. Absolutely pleased with the treatment and results. Thank you to all.

name: Alvin and Jackie Hutchinson
text: Comprehensive Pain and Rehabilitation has taken care of me and other members of my family for several years for chronic back pain due to spinal stenosis and degenerative disc.  They have given me excellent care and treatment, always attentive and show such compassion and concern.  I cannot say enough about the doctors and staff.  They are wonderful! They have always followed up with me after any procedure to make sure I am doing okay.  They have worked with me and my schedule to get me in to see someone on a timely basis.  I greatly appreciate them and their diligence and kindness.

name: Nina Hofman
text: I cannot begin to say how thankful I am for this place! I have multiple problems and without the doctors and the entire staff I would not be walking today! Thank you Dr Barfield Dr Tucker all the staff and special thank you to Rachel!! Merry Christmas! Ps: the Mississippi employees are all great as well! If you are in constant pain this is THE PLACE to start your road to being pain free!

name: ralph sweetland
text: Very unprofessional, that is all I have to say. Terrible bedside manors. If you have problems with pain...... absolutely find somewhere else to go.

name: John Pearson
text: I have degenerative disk disease.  I have had 2 surgeries, one 21 years ago and one about 10 years ago.  I have herniation in L3/L4, L4/L5 and L5/S1.  My nerve corridors are also shrinking.  Not a day goes by I am not in pain.  I was with Dr.  Cockrell at Alabama Orthopedics for 3 years before he decided to no longer do pain medicine.  I did not like AOC, so I went looking for a new doctor in my area.  I found Pain and Rehabilitation.  At first things were ok, nice facility, staff, etc…  I was trying to get my medication switched as well.  I was told the decision would be bases on a psychologist review.  I had my appointment with the psychologist and went over my history, etc…  Psychologist was fine with everything and recommended they continue my medication.  Then things went bad.  I kept getting put off on my medication.  During this time, I had expensive tests done on me.  One was being shocked for 45 minutes to check my nerves (hurt like hell).  Next was putting a needle in my leg and shocking me some more (good lord, what the hay????).  Next, an injection while anesthetized.  I started getting a funny feeling when before every appointment I would get 3 calls to remind me to bring my Co-pay.  Before my injection, I got 5 calls to remind me.  Then I got a call Friday that they would not prescribe my pain medication I need to simply function.  Then it all became clear.  This place did not want to help, they wanted my money.  Multiple calls for co-pays, expensive (and very painful) tests, etc….  They claimed it was illegal to prescribe me my meds, but this is a LIE.  I actually called the Alabama Medical Board and DEA, it is up to doctor’s discretion.  Wow.  So, if you want a bunch of useless and painful test, being bugged to bring your co-pay over and over, and being lied to, please go to Pain and Rehabilitation.  They will be happy to take your money, harass you for co-pays, string you along then lie to you.

text: This review was asked of me, but honestly it’s my honor to compose! In 2008 I was injured and sought medical treatment for lower back pain. Upon several months of on going Dr visits and treatment I was unfortunately forced to undergo Two lower back surgeries which although did not rid my condition completely it did allow me to walk again and I chose to undergo Pain Management with the Center of Pain under the treatment of Dr Herrick. For the past 11 years I have seen Dr Herrick and he and his staff have provide a borderline comfort to ease my pain and give me my life back. Within these past 11yrs I have had to relocated south of his office in Montgomery to Gulf Shores which is roughly 175 miles and again to North Alabama roughly 200 miles away. Being unable to live a life with my family without suffering from daily pain. I am at The mercy of medical treatment. But Being so far away from the Dr Herrick I had to make a simple choice to find a new Dr or travel the 3hrs to continue treatment with the Center of Pain under Dr Herrick treatment. I have had one other Dr in the past 11ys administrate a Epidural to my lower back and I was not satisfied with the treatment nor did this Procedure help my pain. I wish not to speak bad on any other Dr or Pain Management Clinic but for me I have never had one bad experience or visit during my time with the Center of Pain. The staff has always gone above and beyond their means to ensure my visit and treatment has provide relief to my symptoms. Dr Herrick has always been understandable and provided a course of relief for me weather it be medication or procedure Epidurals. If you are suffering from daily pain and currently are seeking help please schedule a appointment  with The center of Pain/Dr Herrick and experience a quality medical facility

text: Great office staff. Wonderful physician.Had an epidural definitely feel significant improvement after. Would highly recommend this office and physician to others. Great experience.

name: Tabitha McGehee
text: I was initially fearful of going to  a pain management physician despite the recommendation of it by both my PCP and my Neurologist, because of my apprehensiveness of traditional opiate use after my past experiences with them. Dr. Meyer, however, did not change the medications I was taking that were working well for me, he simply adjusted the doses and took over the management of them because he is much more experienced in their uses for the control of chronic pain than the physician that was previously handling them had been. He immediately, upon my first visit, ordered new imaging (MRI), which was scheduled and done within a week of my first visit. Then in just one week from my first visit I received an epidural, which helped alleviate much of my constant unwavering pain in my hips and lower back area. He doesn't put you completely to sleep like the places I've been in the past have, where it was an all day event that involved an anesthesiologist. He does them either completely awake or if you're a little apprehensive like I was, offers Versed which helps alleviate much of the nerves and acute pain during the procedure. It was over with quickly and immediately following the procedure I rated my pain 3 points lower on the 0-10 scale, (at a 3 instead of a 6 like when I arrived) and within an hour it even got down to a dull ache instead of the sharper pain I normally experience in my hips. So that is incredible to me! My procedure was yesterday, so I am a little more sore today which is to be expected, but I'm icing it down every hour or so and using over the counter Salonpas Lidocaine patches. Overall, I have been extremely satisfied with Dr. Meyer, in my short time as his patient so far. He is a great bedside manner and his staff is absolutely wonderful!! His assistant in the procedure room was awesome and explained everything to me very thoroughly and answered all of my questions. (And I know I probably had a lot bc I get talkative when I'm nervous. 🤣) The front office staff has been invaluable as well with scheduling and any insurance questions! He is very obviously not out to "make you wait and take your money" like I read that some silly person reviewed prior to me. I even tried to pay my $50 copay at my injection visit and the staff told me just to wait, because often times the insurance companies didn't charge copays on procedure visits, and they didn't want me to pay it if I didn't have to. Dr. Joshua Meyer and the nurse practitioner Hope Craft, FNP that I met, completely only came off as caring and that they are genuinely out to help you live a better quality of life with as little medication and as much activity as you can fit into it! 😊💗

I called later and left a message for the office manager or Dr. Graham's wife to call me back and needless to say that was a week ago and I haven't heard a word.  It's pathetic that a smart mouth receptionist is apparently allowed to speak to patients anyway she chooses and gets away with it.  I wasn't happy with the care I was receiving anyway (two weeks of faxes from the pharmacy and calls from me trying to get a prescription refilled) and three nerve blocks and an Eblation that didn't work, etc., but I most definately won't stay somewhere that has staff like the receptionist. My Father and I have the same name but we don't have the same social security number. I don't understand how they got this on my credit report. I HAVE NEVER BEEN TO THIS PLACE IN MY LIFE!!!! I disputed this account with Experian and this Doctors Office sent it back to the credit bureau as correct. Now I have to hire an Attorney to go after these guys to get this erroneous account off of my credit. NEEDLESS TO SAY, I WILL NEVER GO TO THIS PLACE. THEY ARE BAD!!!

name: Ari Miller
text:
Extremely thorough, caring, professional, and thoughtful staff that does not have high turnover and really gets to know patients personally. I have driven an hour each way, at least once a month, for years, passing by many other pain physicians, to be a patient here. On my first visit, they found two diagnoses, one chronic syndrome and one likely fatal vascular condition, that had gone undetected by countless physicians for over 40 years. Their treatment of these conditions not only likely saved my life, but also greatly increased my quality of life. They offer chronic and acute treatment by a wide range of skilled specialists that is individually prescribed, adapted over time, and always representative of the most current and effective treatments and procedures. I've never encountered bad bedside manners from any physician or nurse. Even office staff is top notch. They are skilled and caring professionals whose goals are to know their patients, provide quality, individualized healthcare, treat a wide array of specialties, and reduce or eliminate pain for truly suffering patients. And because they provide such top-notch, organized, and quality care, they expect and require patients to be compliant, VERY timely, and willing to do their parts to improve their own lives. They are not a pill mill, so drug seekers need not apply.

The ONLY critique I have is that the practice and patient load is rapidly growing, so it has sometimes increased usually very short wait times and made it difficult to be flexible with scheduling appointments. But, they constantly ask for and respond to patient input, so they continue to actively modify their practices to improve these issues. Just growing pains.

Each entrance should have a bathroom on their prospective side. The staff is professional, articulate, compassionate especially Angie, the young lady that schedule procedure appointments. If you are having a bad day her smile and personality will cheer you right up. Other than the bathroom situation I would have given it a 5 star rating.

text:
The physician's & staff help me in managing my chronic lower back/SI joint pain. 34+ years doing what I  loved in the nursing field really took a toll on my joints. I have had both hips replaced now so the "bone on bone" arthritic pain is gone. But sadly my lower back has severe arthritis & a "failed" lower back surgery. I loved my career in nursing. It was my calling so to speak. Joints especially knees & hips wear out. Life happens & we must live it. Taking each day as it comes. I'm grateful because even though retired now I'm able to live my life as fully as possible. Thanks to Alabama Pain Physicians.
Have a blessed day y'all. I know that i shall!

name: Felix Torres
text: Came in for my monthly visit. And for absolutely no reason thats has to do with me. They changed how they are writing up my prescription for every 28 day to 30 days. I been on the 28 day for over 8 years.  They said the reason they changed because SOME pharmacy were filling them 2 days early. I was like what does that have to do with me. I use Weldons pharmacy and they absolutely will not fill my script until the day the doctor wrote the script for. Never has Weldons fill a script early. So they punish everyone because of what SOME pharmacy are doing. All Alabama pain has to do is have everyone bring there bottle in on there visit. And if that person has a date fill thats earlier from what was wrote for. Then change that person to 30 days. Now when i go to my visit on the 31st day. I have no mediation to take until my visit is done then i have to go and have it fill. Which can take over a hour. So by that time i would go over 13 to 14 hours with no pain medication. And suffer and suffer. I have been the perfect patient. I have never in 10 years ever broken any rules. I have bulging dic, i have arthritis in my upper back and i have metal rods in my neck from suffering a broken neck.  I have done my part. And it not fair how Alabama Pain can just changes things on me because of what other people or pharmacy are doing. I am a patient that needs help. Not a convicted drug addit thats was sentenced to you. It was fair and it wasnt right.

He said no I don’t have it but I will need it. I said no problem I will make sure u get it. He didn’t say much then left the room. The nurse came back and said he wants lab work done and copy of the MRI. That’s it!!! So I’m set up to come back in another Month?? WTH ? I will have lab results and MRI sent there in a few days why would they make someone wait that long and be in such horrible pain??? So confused

text: Bad experience.  After considering the experience and series of events I called back the next day and cancelled all treatment.  Confusing, unprofessional, poorly trained personnel, and not a very flattering facility.  It was suggested that I use a Tens unit (they told me this on the way out) and that I wait for a demonstration.  The young lady who did the demo knew absolutely nothing about the unit she was displaying to me.  When she showed me some turn knobs she said "this is where you turn it up".  I asked "what am I doing there?".  She said "I'm not sure, some people like on set on 3 and some like 8".  The tech, the nurse practitioner, and the doctor all had multiple views that never came together.  Came in pain, left in pain.  No one was rude to me.  I was seen in a timely manner.
