name: Diana Johnson
text:
my visit for the last 2 appts.nit PLEASANT @all, this guy (Mickey); ,?or the Nurse practitioner,  thinks, that he's  a Doctor!! there's  no way, he can decide how I feel or how I should be treated,  I kno there're  certain rules or guidelines to  folliw, I am a retired RN, on disability,  BECAUSE  of an awful fall I have had ,unfortunately 2 horrified falls qhuxh resulted in 2 SPINE fusion or Lumbar fusion done @ L4 & L5 with hardware connectin, my spine 2GETHER,  along with (B) KNEE replacement & Lft. shoulder relplaced, Rgt, shoulder rotator cuff!! unfortunately for me my whole body is in chronic pain daily, with resulting with chronic  Arthritis,  THAT'S the REASON I,  cone to your clinic, FOR the Doctors to help me & to try to keep the pain level down, I kno nothin really stops back pain, but there're meds, that can quiet it down, s people can try to keep movin FORWARD.No
one want to stop & give up on life, because of chronic pain!! unfortunately,  you have PEOPLE,  that's can T deal with the pain mentally & physically , becomes to much.
I owe my ability  to GOD,to be able to reach out to the pain specialist for help, but I don't want to be made felt like a DRUG SEEKER OR A DRUG ADDICT,  I AM SOMEBODY,  & I HAVE MY PRIDE, I LIKE TO BE TREATED  FAIRLY,& WITH RESPECT. I feel as though, a person kno their body & how their body feels, no one should be ABLE  CRITIQUE how your Body feel, or if a particular program is working for your body, then why interupt it?? I kno there're certain guidelines,rules ^ regulations  to follow, but then there's a certain way to handle siruarions!! I have only met 1 Doctor & seen only by her, when I first was evaluated there, which is fine, the problem  is this guy DOESN'T  listen to peiple, he thinks & make decisions for a person without  really LISTEN  ^ that's not humanly possible,  I did over hear other patients  discussing  the same individual, while waitin, in Prescriptions,  last month,  I waited Along with other people 2hours, they had been waiting  2 hrs, b4 me, and it was rhe same CRNP, 2 DA, I TALK TO HIM ABOUT THE WAIT TIME, 2DA, IT STILL TOOK 1 HR. BUT IT WAS 1 HR, LESS THAN LAST TIME,  I PRAY ^ HOPE THINGS WILL GET BETTER, BECAUSE , I CIME TO THE CLINIC, NOT BECAUSE  I WANT TO BE IN A PAIN CLINIC & TAKE THE MEDS THAT I TAKE, IT'S  BECAUSE  I TRULY NEED TO BE THERE!! THANK YOU FOR LISTENING  & TAKIN TIME TO REVIEW THIS STATEMENT!! YOU REALLY DO HAVE A VERY NICE FACILITY AND A NICE LOCATION,  THKU, FOR ALLOWING ME TO BE A PATIENT  THERE.

name: Robin Thomas
text: Going here for over five years. Been complaining of pain getting worse over the past few years, no changes. My dr left, then my replacement dr left. Still complaining of worsening pain so my fill-in, Dr Arrtie Pisaturo decides to REDUCE my pain meds after "looking at my chart". What?! I can't imagine what she possibly could've seen in my chart to come to this decision. I have felt for a very long time that I haven't been listened to, so there's no telling what the nurses have entered, especially considering it's very rare to see the same one more than once, and the patient portal is completely useless. All they seem to want to do is give you refills on your current prescriptions and get you out of there as soon as possible (I mean out of the exam room, because you have to go back to the waiting room and wait for an eternity to be given your prescriptions. They have to wait until the drs are between procedures to sign the prescriptions.). And no, I'm definitely not a drug seeker. I don't like being on opioids. I stressed this to my original dr and we discussed trying the Medtronic device when I talked to him before a spinal injection. I was so enthusiastic and told him I'd love to try it. That was the end of it. I didn't get to discuss it with him again because you're "not allowed" to see your dr unless it's your first visit as a new patient or when he talks to you right before you're wheeled in for a procedure. And I haven't had any more procedures. I feel like the patients are just paychecks to the drs and nothing more. I know its not just me because I hear conversations between other patients in the waiting room. I'm looking for a new pain management dr but am also afraid of winding up in another place such as this.

name: Beverly Clark
text: My mother who is 85 yrs old has been going there for about ,2 yrs had never had a problem when Dr. Martin Was. There but since the new Dr started has only seen her1 time and when i asked them for help getting a pa from Dr.shewas never allowed to see her and the insurance co would call and tell me that they needed more information they told me no. They could not let her talk to physician. They had sent everything in but this all could all have been cleared up if only they would have let me speak to Dr.and then said you and you and your daughter have just worried us sick about this  drug trying to get it .. approved well isn't this their job. She went 16 days without. Her meds and was so sick most of the time she could not call herself. Then we went back for her app.and the office manager told her they needed to see her alone so went out. Then they guestioned her like  she was a criminal she said i got so nervous i could not even think of what dates things happened on. Then they told my mother well we are not giving you anything because we think your daughter is taking your meds with no reason to talk to her in that manner. She told them no i keep up with my meds. And i was the one they slandered. Please know my mother always passed her drug test. Any thoughts of what i should say to them or take an ,85 yrs old woman to find another Dr. Please let me know what you think we should do my mother is a chronic pain pt and can't even walk but has to use a power chair.

text: The staff and Dr. Hollon have consistently exceeded my expectations for years. I'm leaving their parking lot today with no neck-related pain whatsoever after walking into their office in considerable pain. Thank you!

name: Pamela Mills
text: At 65 years old, I had never had a reason to go to a chiropractor until now. A friend recommended Dr. Hollon, so I went to Health Star chiropractic in Prattville. What an amazing experience! Dr. Hollon , Dr. Parker and the staff here are super! They explain everything they do, as well as how each therapy should help take care of the problem you came in with. They get to know you on a personal level. You are not just a name or number coming through their door! They are great at scheduling your therapy appointments around your schedule and wonderful if you need to reschedule! I am now in my follow up and maintenance phase with exercises to do at home for continuing healing. I simply cannot say enough good things about my experience here and would recommend this practice to anyone!

text: I've been seeing Dr. Long for about 2 years now and would highly recommend this doctor to anybody that needs pain management. He has treated and helped me since I've started seeing him.

name: Tom
text: This was my first visit to Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants.  I found the staff to be highly professional, compassionate, and great listeners.  In particular, I was impressed with Nurse Practitioner Amy.  She made me feel at home and carefully documented my symptoms and medical history.  She explained some of procedures that were offered by the Tennessee Pain Consultants, but recommended an MRI as the first step in establishing a course of care.  I must admit that I was a bit apprehensive at first, but I quickly found comfort with Nurse Practitioner Amy’s manner and professionalism.  This is a great Medical Center for those of us that are aging and have developed increasing discomfort as a result.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Runner for the kind review! We're so glad you had a great experience at our office. We'll be sure to share your comments with our Nurse Practitioner Amy.

name: Dee Bberry
text: Facilities were clean.  parking deck was packed. Check-in service wasn't unfriendly. Wait from appointment time until actually being called back to room was an hour and a half. Nursing staff was excellent, very competent & very friendly! Once prepared for procedure, the process went rapidly... I was taken to the procedure room on the half hour, was unconscious in about five minutes,  & thirty minutes later I'm waking in recovery to the excellent nursing staff.

name: David CRAPPS
text:
I woke up in extreme pain, they had pierced the artery during the cervical epidural as was bleeding into the spinal canal and the pressure from the blood  was causing my spinal cord  to fight for space. Told them I needed a doctor and they kept insisting I was fine and needed to go home and lay down
. Insisted on a doctor and was told there wasn't one there to see me I had to do home. Long story short I nearly lost my life due to a spinal hematoma 16 inch scare 7 level laminectomy.  All this due to a staff person and a doctor late for a golf date or lack of belief that I was in serious pain and about to die. Rethink who is working on you ,the only thing they did from that point forward is try to get me off the patient list

name: Tyler Rains
text: Everyone was super nice and nurse explained a lot and suggested Botox injections for my pain. That was 2 months ago and they still have not gotten me back in, took 8 phone calls to get someone to a least give me some clue as to what’s taking so long but still waiting. If you see someone they are great but don’t be in any hurry on getting relief from your pain!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear you have not been contacted back. It is very important to schedule our patients as quickly as possible. Please Email our patient advocate with your phone number and we will contact you today info@tnvalleypain.com. Thank you!

name: Britt Clark
text:
Veterans beware! VA Choice scheduled me to go here. TVPC tried to schedule me for 30 days out, which is the reason VA Choice exists, so we dont have to wait 30 days to see a Doctor. When talking to Patty about the appt., I informed them that the reason for Veterans Choice was so Veterans could see a Dr within 30 days and that the wait was actually shorter to see the VA Doctor. TVPC contacted the VA and made sure that they told the VA "several times" what was said, even though the comments were sarcastic and not accurate.
The following statement is now in my Permanent VA Medical records. "Per Patty at Tenn Valley pain patient stated "That if he had to wait then he would be better off buying his meds in the project."" I spoke to TVPC today and was told that it doesnt matter what I say or how it was said, it will be documented. Veterans have enough problems getting the meds we need from the VA due to the Opioid Safety Initiative as well as trying to get proper health care. We really dont need the help of Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants making sure the VA documents that Veterans are drug addicts or buy illegal drugs.

name: Gloria Jean Gregory
text: Dr. Collins is my doctor. I have never experienced any problems at the Tennessee Valley Pain Center. The staff is excellent! I have been a patient there for several years. If you have chronic pain, you need to make an appointment. By managing my pain with steroid injections in my spine and pain medicine as needed, pain doesn’t interrupt my life every day now. Without treatment through the Tennessee Valley Pain Center my pain would be debilitating.

resp.text: Ms. Gregory, Thank you so much for your kind review! We are very pleased to hear you are able to enjoy life without spine pain. It's our privilege to care for you!

name: Shelby Cooley
text: One of the worst Nurse Practitioners I've ever had the displeasure of meeting. Her name was Amy. She was inconsiderate and continued to have a tone throughout the entire consult whilst continuing to raise her voice. The overall lack of sympathy and compassion was horrendous and greatly upsetting.She continued to be standoffish and whenever I showed concern about my medication and tried to express the deep pain I was in, due to the fact that I have multiple cysts and discs within my spine and suffer from extreme headaches and anxiety. She continued to verbally assault me insisting on the injections without allowing me to ask questions or speak. When I informed her as to the fact that I would be getting my first Covid-19 vaccine, she told me that I would have to wait 5-6 weeks before getting said procedure. When I asked her what I should do if and when I ran out of pain medication, she brushed me off and lazily suggested anti-inflammatories. This showed that she was not listening to me, as I had said multiple times before that I could not take any NSAID's or prednisone due to a gastric sleeve surgery I had. I have suffered multiple heart-attacks as well as many health problems, and other traumatic and stress inducing experiences, such as a mother living with me and passing away. I tried to tell her that the stress of managing our large farm and taking care of my child and our business was very stressful and that my anxiety medication was needed, she scoffed and mocked me saying, "Well I have a farm and kids..." as if to prove a point and insult me. When I asked her if she was in fact 52 and doing that? She had no response.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear about your negative experience as well as your anxiety and pain. Per FDA contraindication guidelines, we are unable to prescribe anxiety and opioid pain medications simultaneously for patient safety. We value your feedback and encourage you to contact our office at (256) 265-7246 if you would like to discuss your specific case further.  Best, TVPC

name: Rebecca Selvage
text: My name is Sylvia Davis go at least three times of year to Tennessee Valley Pain  in Huntsville AL   and doc  Morris does the burning of the nerves in my lower back and he's also does a nerve block in 3 months an then 7monts later I have it All done again.. I have scoliosis have stenosis narrowing of the spine l5 s1 and the ones up above it are all bone on bone I was told I'd never be out of pain unless I had this surgery takes two days to complete cut your belly open put in spacers and you rest up the next day then on 3rd day they'll open my back an put all bones back in straight then put pins screws and Rod's.pins holds it all together....I'm still pondering whether to have it or not ..my ❤️ not good I had a stroke in 2015 7months after momma past away .I'm in great hands at HUNTSVILLE TVP .. Dr.Morris Scherlis He's an Awesome sweet handsome man on top of things  he has your MRI on the screen and knows exactly what he need to do to make me better .I've given him full rights to do Whatever he needs to do just get me out of pain .he does a awesome job .I've been going since 2014 best Dr .. they treat you with respect and Care they tell you what's happening with you till your asleep . Cindy Stratton (West )

name: Tom Hollingshead
text: At 58 years I was seriously considering medical retirement.  Degenerative arthritis in the lower back had reduced my height two inches, inflammation affected surrounding tissues causing intense muscle spasms and torn muscles.  For years I’d taken pain drugs, but could no longer tolerate reduced mental capabilities at work (Analyst).  I was referred to Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants and was amazed by the effectiveness of the shots, which were 90-100%.  I did not retire until age sixty nine.  I continue to enjoy my treatments in retirement, performing household chores such as lawn cutting, trimming and edging.  My recreation includes boating/fishing, walking for exercise, and several week-long SCUBA diving trips per year.  Dr. John Roberts has provided all my treatments through the years and I make it a point each trip to tell him he changed my life and is my Hero.

name: Cathy Clark

I have been a patient of Dr Scherlis for quite a few years. The doctors and staff are always kind and courteous. I most often see Michelle and she is the best! Always kind and and very professional. I also love the new office where there is hardly ever more than a ten minute wait.
CKC

name: Pat Wells
text: I have been going to Dr. Scherlis for 20 years. When I first started going a neurologist referred me to him for some tests. When he gave me the results he said he could help me but he wanted the neurologist to refer me for treatment that he would not take a patient away from another doctor.  That showed me that he respected the other doctor. My first visit after that I was given a prescription. When I went back he suggested an epidural.  After the epidural did not give me much relief he said there was no need to do the epidural if they weren't going to work.  I was treated the next 3 years with medication.  He suggested maybe we could try the epidural again.  The decision was mine after he explained everything to me.  I have had epidurals regularly since then.  I see his Nurse practitioner Amy Harbin monthly.  She is great. She talks to you about your pain level and if I get any relief from the meds or how much relief I got from the procedures. When I get my procedures Dr Scherlis is fantastic.  He comes in and talks to you and he makes me feel he is truly concerned if what they are doing is helping me. Dr. Scherlis has helped me when I was fighting breast cancer and chemo, and many surgeries.  At this time, I have to get the epidurals and nerve blocks regularly for degenerative disc and pain from scar tissue. I have recommended Dr. Scherlis to many people.  I know I have the best pain doctor in this town.  I have read the bad reviews  and I have never experienced any of the issues they have brought up. The desk personnel has always been very polite and friendly.  He has a nurse, Connie that is absolutely fantastic.  Many times I have gone in feeling down but they always reassure me that they have the best treatments in mine for me. Dr. Scherlis, Amy, and Connie. thank you for making my life so much better while living with the chronic pain. Y'all are the best.

name: Barbara Wilson
text: I’m a patient of Dr. Scherlis.   He is a caring professional who has helped  my painful condition become more bearable.      Michelle CRNP is our professional advisor.  She is always there to help me anyway she can.  She cares about me not only as a patient, but as a wife, mother, and grandmother.  As for me and my husband, she is our rock we lean on and our strong connection to Dr. Scherlis.

name: Andy Harbin
text:
I’ve been a patient of TVPC for a few years. I was seen by NP Greg. He listened to my issues addressed all concerns I had and put a game plan together. He was very respectful and professional. He seemed to  genuinely care and show concern for my issues.

Greg set me up to meet with Dr. Scherlis. Dr. Scherlis is my kind of doctor. He’s serious but also has a good sense of humor. He doesn’t tell you what you want to hear but what you need to hear. He listened to me and my problems and came up with a course of action (injections) to treat my ailments. I not a fan of needles but he made it quick and almost pain free. It was by far the best treatment option for me. If I ever need pain management again I won’t hesitate call Dr. Scherlis.

The whole staff makes you feel welcomed. I’ve read reviews saying “people here are rude” well you get what you give. Yes the wait times can be long and the lobby full but that to me is a sign of a staff doing something right. I would highly recommend Dr. Scherlis, NP Greg Gore or any of the capable staff at TVPC if you are looking to treat and manage your pain.  Once again thank you TVPC for helping me.

name: tommy perry
text: I have been going to TVPC  for years ,Dr.Scherlis ,Michelle and everyone from the front desk have always been very professional and polite. I have not had any problems, I would recommend TVPC to anyone!!!!

TVPC is very caring and thorough starting with the first visit and especially on every procedure.   His NPR Amy, has always gone above and beyond with any question and or concern we have on every visit.  My husband will someday have to have surgery but he sure appreciates being able to function with minimal pain until that point.  We are very grateful for the services we receive at TVPC and would highly recommend them.

text: I’ve had knee pain for years. Had steroid injections that finally didn’t help much anymore. Dr. Roberts has done neck epidurals for me for years and he did the knee injections. I am finished with the series now and have greatly reduced pain and much better range of motion.

name: Ross Huntsville
text:
I had my first appointment with Dr. Gantt (for Fibromyalgia pain) and staff yesterday.  First, when I was taken back by a nurse, I was told I would be seeing Kristy (nurse practitioner), not Dr. Gantt.  I told the nurse that I was told, when the appointment was made, I was told that I would be seeing Dr. Gantt. The general nurse and nurse practitioner were only worried about my bipolar meds, because they showed up on the urine specimen.  The nurse who administers the urine test, opened the door to my room and then shut the door because she was scared of my service dog (I cannot be the only client with a service dog) and they had to find a nurse to come in and give me the urine specimen cup.  After seeing the nurse practitioner, Dr. Gantt came in.  He said they don't treat Fibromyalgia, unless it is just injections into the muscles, and he was willing to schedule that without doing any MRI's, X-Rays, etc.  He also told me I needed to come off my bipolar meds and my Fibromyalgia meds and just keep a pain journal.

I will never be back to this facility, and I highly recommend if you can go to another facility that you do.  All they want to do is give you injections or blocks.  Definitely not up my alley without any proof those are needed.

name: Debra Green
text: Was a patient of Dr Collins for years. Had a lot of blocks. Last visit I was givin a drug test. Failed for something I have never touched. The cup they gave me didn’t have my name on it. I was terminated. I don’t think I should have been. Thinking about getting a lawyer and fighting it. They messed my urine up with someone else’s. NOT HAPPY

If at all possible go elsewhere - you will waste a lot of time, and they will take care of you whenever they feel like getting around to it.  :( Edit: It has now been 4 days and still no prescription. His CRNP Heather is FABULOUS (unfortunately Heather is no longer there). This is a very clean, professional staff and office for the most part. Front office staff is typically very friendly. I drive an hour nearly to this practice.

Update 12/25/2019: it seems the “wait time issue has been addressed for now. The last several times I have visited, I waited less than an hour before being seen! Thank you to whomever seems to be getting this under control.
—————————————————————-
The rest of my previous review from 2018 follows for FYI only...I had given them 5 stars for their practice but noted zero stars for the wait time, per below. I’ve revised it above and giving them 3 stars for wait and keeping the 5 overall for the practice.
Evidently after reading consistent posts from others about multi-hours long wait times, nothing has been done. The only reason I continue to come is because I like the practice. If waiting for hours (I've waited four before but typically at least 2 hours every time to even be called back and  then often I wait another hour once back.) only happened infrequently, I'd not be extremely frustrated about it. Seeing that this is a consistent problem with scheduling and others are waiting hours in a literally packed waiting room and it's still an issue, certainly makes me think that the gracious feedback being given by others to help the office manager improve the practice means nothing to them and the replies promising to take care of things are evidently empty words. Please do something about hours of wait time besides just "I'm sorry, I've shared your concerns." Words without actions to correct the problem are just as frustrating. Feedback, even if negative, is a gift. People don't have to give it, but it's an opportunity for you all to offer patients a complete positive experience and not one just limited to doctors, CRNPs and front office staff. Besides, aren't you the least bit frustrated at your ratings and reviews? Come on! You all are better and more professional that that.

name: Ineke' Allen
text: I called & again I was on the phone 4 awhile. I tried to change my appointment(I have an appointment tomorrow at 9:30)to the end of the month(budgeting reasons) no return call or anything. I would love to speak to a manager in the morning as soon as possible. Hopefully I can get an appointment at the end of the month, without any problems or having to wait another month to get in.

name: Camillia Harrison
text: I have been going here for about 3 yrs. They have helped me tremendous with my pain. They have a  friendly staff.

name: Ronald Hopkins
text: Tennessee valley pain clinic has been very professional with me  there staff are and Doctors nurse practitioner Michelle cobble and Doctor scherlis always have time to talk and listen to you and help you .

name: Felicia Stinnett
text: They are a fine group of people.Real nice nurses..

name: Darrel hancock
text:
The WORST place to see a Dr. within a reasonable time of your designated appt. My 80 +year old dad who is a diabetic and other health issues has to wait 11/2 hours and longer to get a shot that might last 2 weeks. I have been told by a reliable source that the scheduler has been told to over book appts in case there is cancellations everyday. That is NOT for the patients benefit but for these doctors and the faculty. It is uncalled for and someone outside this institution needs to investigate. They have NO concern for patients well being.
Whoever the scheduler is and who ever tells them to over book should be dismissed. Money HUNGRY doctors and hospital!!!!
And yes, I would love to get a response from anyone connected
UPDATE: June 23 2020
Dad's apt @ 10:45 with only one person with him as a family member and driver, @12:10 pm he goes back for a 10 min proceedure with recovery of about 45 min.
The worse part is dad is 82 yrs old, Parkinson's and a diabetic and they, being the Pain Clinic does NOT seem to really care about the welfare of the patients.
It is pathetic how this place operates. It will NEVER change. It's a money hungry, overbook daily on purpose, and always want to give excuses as to why things happen. It's always, " got behind schedule" thing. Easy way to solve it? Be reasonable with your scheduling. So what if you have a cancellation, you will for the first time EVER be ahead of schedule.
I would more than love for the person who is totally, alone, in charge of this place and it's operation to call me. Just send me a message and I will send you my number. Seems like the drs don't care about the patients wait times, about the numbers. After looking at parient reviews, i see where alot of the same drs where getting good reviews. I also see where out of 6 pages of reviews, dad's dr had only 6? Hmmm?
Put yourselves in the place of elderly with diabetes and nothing to  eat since last night. Put yourself in the place of the caregivers who see after the patients.
Guess it does not really matter to you!

name: Joy Bradford
text: I have been coming here for years and although there was a wait time in the lobby my actual appointment was pretty quick. But I have to say that the last 4 or 5 appointments I have had ,has had me arriving mad and leaving mad . It has more to do with the parking deck than anything else . I always arrive 30 minutes early in case there is a traffic problem since I live in moulton and have to drive so far. Thankfully I do ,because I have been having to go up and down that parking deck 3 times to find a parking space along with at least 5 or more other cars. Plus there is really not a safe way to turn around on the top or bottom of this deck and we pay $ 2.00 to be ill. What would happen if I was late for my appointment because I couldn't park anywhere?Why would you not have a way to keep people from coming in, if the deck is full? Come on now as tech savvy as the world is now this should not be an issue. Please address this problem. Thank you.

name: Adrienne Jones
text: The front desk and nursing staff is the best thing about this place. Constantly in pain even after spine injections, sucks. Last doctor did spine injections and they didn’t help so I didn’t understand why they would also continue with them. I just try to manage the pain the best I can while looking for new pain management doctor. Very disappointed.

name: Elizabeth Lee
text: Dr. Gantt, Kristie, and all the staff are great!

name: Justin “GrumpyGamer” Herring
text:
The nurses and doctors are great. The reason for one star is the office managers who set appointments. Why do you schedule so many people to be at suite 310 when you good and well know how many seats are in that office! So doesn't it make sense to try and keep people away from each other so the spread of germs is kept minimal? You have eight chairs in that room yet you schedule 20 patients at a time? Whomever thinks that is an acceptable policy needs to find another job. You also work in a pain clinic you know patients do not come alone! Five other patients said the same thing about this practice.
So 50 minutes past an appointment time, because they schedule to many people, for the same appointment time. So I rescheduled my appointment and then had a thought why can't I just pick up what I need on my procedure day. So I call back to wait 20 minutes for someone to answer the phone just to cancel an appointment. I know they could give two cents if they lost a patient. We are just like cattle to them there are always more to replace, always someone to take your place. If you like long waits and incompetent scheduling this is the place for you.

name: Randy Spearman
text:
I have recently learned, that all the trying to get something done to help my back has finally happened. But let me tell the story of how long it took.  I started on June 8 trying to get in to see anybody about my back. It seems that an old injury had resurfaced, I called at least two times a week to get in. But to no response. I had a regular office visit on the 26th, in which they immediately set me up with an MRI. On the 27 th. The office called me on the 28th, and told me dr scherilis wanted to refer me to an neurosurgeon . But unfortunately the one that I saw on the 26th had written it up wrong, she said it happened at home, in which of course it did. I've been out of work because of that injury since 2008. Anyway the ones in billing charged it to my Medicare without my permission. I had no idea. Until I received the bill from the ones I got the MRI from. I began calling TVPC to let them know they were wrong in sending it to my Medicare, that the only reason I go to TVPC is on workers compensation only. Well anyway I fought and fought with first the ones in the office then with the ones in billing. They even charged my Medicare for an office visit I had to give a definition to workers comp. before they would okay my referral. Any way it went on since June 8 through sept 18 when they finally sent dr Parker all the info he needed through WC to get me in. Unfortunately the closet appointment they had was Oct. 23. So it has taken  a total of 5 months,living in excruciating pain to get in to get something done because of the ones in billing at the TVPC, I I called and sent e-mails to everyone that was in authority to try to help me. I even call my workers comp manager. And she told me she never got the correct paperwork from the Tennessee Valley Pain Center. They called me a week before dr Parkers office did to let me know that it was them in the office that screwed up, because of documentation on their part. But any way I am Finally getting to see someone that can help me. I'm going to try with all that's in me to get my workers comp. manager to change me to the TOC for pain management they have it all now. So if you read this whole story beware the office personnel and the billing personnel. They will get things screwed up and will not believe a thing you try and convince them of. Maybe I will be able to say solong to TVPC.
Y

name: Vickie Griffin
text: The complaint I have with TVPC is the $2.00 fee you have to pay to get out of the parking garage I have a pretty big Co-pay and I really don't have the extra money to pay to just be able to get out of the garage it's very disappointing and I'm sure I'm not the only one that feels this way. I really feel we should not be charged a fee to leave a physician's office.

name: Donna Butcher
text:
THIS MIGHT BE LONG BUT ALL POTENTIAL PATIENTS NEED TO READ & BEWARE!

I have worked in the medical field since I was 19 years of age, which I will admit is greater than 20 years, so I have not only knowledge of a medical office but also knowledge of medical insurance and how it works.
When an office tells you they are going to schedule an "outpatient office procedure", ASK LOTS OF QUESTIONS & TELL THEM TO BE SPECIFIC!   I should not be expected to pay a HOSPITAL outpatient procedure copay for a "simple in office procedure"!  Yes, there are exceptions depending on how the office is credentialed with the payers.  And yes, patients (including myself, which I am) should make themselves aware of their own insurance, how it pays, pricing of copays etc., but common courtesy from a medical office towards the patient should include that when a procedure is schedule (because not everyone works in the medical field and is familiar with the ins and outs of insurance filing, payments etc) inform the patient completely with ALL expectations of not only what will happen with the procedure itself but also, what the patient needs to expect to be paying for said procedure!
I phoned the TN Valley Pain Consultants 2 HOURS ahead of my procedure to see what the minimum amount of things I needed to have with me as I would not have someone to "keep my things" while in the procedure.  I was told to just bring an ID and my debit card for my copay.  I naturally asked, “what copay? I was not informed of any copay that would apply.  I was told this is an office procedure; therefore, I have already paid my office copay at my office visit.”  I was then (2 HOURS BEFOREHAND MIND YOU) informed I had to pay $150 for the procedure today!  I have to admit, I almost blew a gasket.   They did offer (oh so generously *note sarcasm*) to deduct $50 every 2 weeks from my paycheck to pay for the copay.  I promptly told them, if I had an extra $100 within the next month, I could pay the entire bill today!
After some polite as possible, albeit extremely angry words (after being told that it is MY responsibility to know my insurance), I told them to cancel the procedure and THEN I was told I would have a $25 cancellation fee because it was within 24 hours!  They are going to try to get money out of you any way possible!
Long story and somewhat not so short IF YOU USE TN VALLEY PAIN CONSULTANTS………DO SO WITH EXPECTATIONS THAT YOU WILL HAVE TO PAY $ AT THE LAST MOMENT AND THEY DO NOT INFORM YOU PROPERLY!  I PERSONALLY WILL BE AVOIDING THEM TOTALLY!!

name: christie bickelman
text: Dr. Scherlis treated me for 18-months -rhizotomies on my lower back. I have moved from Huntsville and am in fear that I’m going to go back to being in pain. when I was treated by Dr. Scherlis, I was pain-free.

name: Alistair Campbell
text: Can't even get a real person to answer the phone after a dozen attempts over a period of a week. If it is this difficult to get through before getting a so-called consultation, then what must it be like to get through when it is far more important? Two thumbs down to spitting on the customer right at the front door via horrible customer service and a total disconnect from reality. What's more, those with an IQ above 70 generally hate robotic answering machines, especially those that fail to even offer alternative categories to the limited scripts being provided. That said, Lord only knows how many patients they've lost as a direct result of treating people worse than a typical government agency. Shame on you for inducing the PAIN of aggravation. o_O

name: angela Martin
text: Please take the time to read and consider my review before visiting this facility. I started off their with the best Doc. and thanks to the staff my relationship that I thought I had with my Doc is not as it seemed. I gave a review on their website, but it was not posted. I'm guessing it was because I had nothing good to say about the staff. My Doctor and his nurse relocated to this office a few months ago. My first visit was good because I was allowed to see my Doctor. Now I know it was for show. After that day I would have a visit scheduled to see him, but would not get to. unless I insisted and had to get upset before they would schedule me to see him. They also were caught telling lies to MY Doctor, my Insurance co. and me.  They would say things like, they had talked to my ins co about my treatment and then tell the Doc that the Ins co was no help, when in fact they never called. It was confirmed by the ins agent in charge. They would tell me similar things. They also told the ins co and my Doc that I had discharged myself as a patient when I had said no such thing. For two weeks I was unable to get any messages to my Doctor. I found out later, when they admitted that they never took my messages.  I would not give this facility one star except you have to choose one just to give a review.  Before my Doc  came to this place I received the best treatment from him and his nurse, but since he relocated here I have not been able to get regular visits with him or get messages to him. I was told several times by the staff, things about my doc that I knew not to be true. It was as they were trying to get his patients to see someone else or go somewhere else. They spoke of him as if he were not qualified to do any task or treatment that he had done for me for several yrs. I fear that due to the staff at Tennessee valley pain consultants, I have lost a great Doctor of about 7yrs. If Dr. Kraus were not at this facility I would highly recommend him for your care, but as long as he continues to work there the care will never be the same. I am very disappointed that Dr. Kraus has not contacted me to resolve the issue. I'm positive that he is not aware of what is really being said and done behind his back.

name: NoLimit95
text: Dr. Krauss accused me of doing cocaine on my 2nd drug test after 9 months.... I do not and have not touched cocaine in any shape, form or fashion and he wouldn't even discuss why I tested on Sept 11th, test was sent to the lab on the 13th and they had the results back on Sept 18th, then didn't bother to call me then. They instead were so unorganized that I went and picked up my refill for pain medicine for October with no problem. Then on my November appt, that's when he decides to tell me I had 26.0ng show up in the lab results. "You had cocaine in your system, so unfortunately, I can't write you any pain medicine". That's what the man said. A few days later, I set up an appt to go discuss the results he had just devastated me with. The nurse calls me at 8:30am that morning and said "Dr. Krauss is cancelling the appt for today because he said he already discussed this with you and he is dismissing you. You will be receiving a letter in the mail". Now it's mid Jan 2018 and I have yet to get the letter. I'm still showing as "active" in their online system and my chart online also says "COCAINE ABUSE". Thanks a lot Dr. Krauss. Organize your practice and set down man to man and discuss 2 month old lab results, if someone really tests positive for street drugs. You know who I am. Remember, you said "I could have wiped my hand across a countertop, unknowingly ingesting cocaine"? Remember me now? You are one sorry doctor! Now my name is online for any doctor to see "COCAINE ABUSE" when I don't even do the drug. Sounds like defamation of character to me.

name: P/D Lindstrom
text:
I was a patient at this pain clinic for around 8 years.  I had pain from a hip fracture of my left leg and due to need of a knee replacement on my right knee.  But I couldn't have that done until my left hip issues resolved.  As one therapist put it " You haven't got a leg to stand on!"  So true.

But you know, in the entire 8 years I went to this pain clinic, I never once met the doctor whose signature was on the auto-printed refill scripts, already printed off before my appointment even began.

For a time, the psychiatrist I was seeing prescribed the drug Saphris for me for my depression.  That drug had the most insidious side effects. So insidious, I couldn't tell for sure whether the problems I experienced beginning months after first starting Saphris were from that drug or something else.  I told the psychiatrist this, and he doubled the amount of Saphris I was taking.

Within a year i was experiencing periods of sleeplessness that could last 3-4 nights in a row. I was tired but too restless to sleep.  I repeatedly lost my car keys, the glass of tea I had set down somewhere, and worst of all - my purse and/or cellphone.  This was particularly anxiety producing when it occurred when I was out shopping.

I knew that the medications I took had to be kept in their original bottles. So, if I lost my purse shopping, I made a police report and then had to call my doctors to explain what happened. When I called my doctors to tell them of my predicament, I got refills (I had to pay for in full out of pocket) and I believe in the final year and a half I took this Saphris drug, I lost my purse six times!

The pain clinic recorded every call I made to explain what had happened again.  Also in that final year and a half of taking Saphris, although I felt fully capable of driving I still had six inexplicable car accidents. Luckily, no one was seriously injured.  But my car had to be loaded up and hauled away and twice my purse got left in my towed away car.

On these occasions, I had to call and explain what happened to my doctors and the pain clinic. The pain clinic refused to give me a refill.  But one of those times I found out where my car was hauled off to, and the next day was able to go and rummage through my car, find where my purse had landed in the accident, and thank God, nothing had been taken from it. I called all my doctors and the plain clinic back to cancel my refill requests, even calling the pain clinic to let them know I had recovered my pain med script.

About 8 years into my medication treatment at the pain clinic, I was asked when I'd had my last pain pill. I told them honestly at that morning appointment I'd taken a last pain pill late the previous evening.  For the first time in my life I was asked to provide a urine sample.  I had no qualms about doing that because I had no reason to worry -- or so I thought.

But the nurse came back in and told me my urine sample results were negative.  1st drug test I'd ever had. NEGATIVE!!??  Why? How?  Can we repeat the test right now?  No?  I wa being immediately dismissed, and was told no, I couldn't talk to the doctor. Well, since I never had & had no idea what he looked like...

I never once saw a real MD or DO there. The way they acted was mute testimony to the fact they had no interest trying to find out why the 1 & only test I'd ever had was negative. Asked to at least speak with the doctor.  I was scared. I'd heard you never just stop a drug you've taken a long time. I was forbidden doing that too!

3 days later, form letter came.  Said I was dismissed for not following contract. Huh? 2nd form letter came next day. This one said I'd failed the drug test -was dismissed. Failed it? W/o further study, that's pretty dubious thing to claim.

Had gone on Medicare that yr. MDs aren't reimbursed as much by Medicare. Likely THAT is real reason they wanted me gone!  Later called back and asked nurse what difference was between drug dependence and drug addiction. She couldn't answer that.  Long term pain med therapy often produces dependence NOT addiction!

text:
They have the best prices and must effective treatment available. Dr. Kaul and his staff were very friendly and helpful. I woke up with crippling neck pain---literally---my mom had to come to my house and help me out of bed, that's how great my neck pain was,  I was completely helpless in trying to use my neck muscles to lift my head up from my pillow!

Instead of going to an urgent care facility like how I initially planned, my mom suggested going to a chiropractor because she had similar issues in her hip and she told me how a chiropractor adjusted her joints back into place and she was able to walk out of the office after that as if the pain never existed. She recommended Mobile Chiropractic and I decided to give it a shot. Dr. Kaul worked his magic with his hands on my neck and did something funny to it and cracked my neck back into place and I almost immediately felt a hundred times better!  If you have any type of musculoskeletal pains, I highly recommend you go to Mobile Chiropractic. I, without a doubt, am sure they can help you!

After 4 underwater ultrasound therapy session and adjustments my ankle is back to my normal size and pain free for the first time in 2 years and no medicines involved !!! All the staff (including the therapist and Dr. Kaul) is super friendly and makes you feel like family. Had no idea I would feel so great so quickly !! Will definitely be back whenever I get any aches/pains !!

name: NoMercenary
text:
In short summary, these are great people, made me feel comfortable, and i would recommend to others. The staff always had a smile on their faces, and treated me like family. The doctors I dealt with were very friendly, open to any questions/concerns. Awesome experience, everytime.

Longer version, but adds great insight..
I dislocated my knee years ago, and needed help FAST. I was without insurance but they said they could still help. They gave me a discounted rate, and began trying to treat me.
In short, i torn a ligament, and had to have surgery, so the doctor sent me to a colleague.
Flash forward years later, and i'm having harsh pains in my lower back, from my work field. I return to this clinic, because of previous great services. My original doc wasn't working anymore, so i was taken in by Dr Kaul himself.
This continued for weeks, him helping keep my pain at a good, manageable level. I started to go less and less, as the pain started to simply vanish...Till...
I got into a car wreck. My neck started to feel awful sore 2 days later, and i got worried.
I then began looking for an accident lawyer, and through high google reviews, went to Moore's law-firm. I spoke with them, and was asked if i was being treated for the pain. I told them not yet, but i used to go to a local chiropractor, and was gonna go back very, very soon.
I was asked where i went, and when told, the lawyer started laughing, the doctor, and the lawyer have been college for the longest time, and the lawyer sends hundreds of cases to Dr Kaul....Huh, small world..
My lawyer knows my doctor..
So to shorten this some, i was treated by Dr Kaul over a couple months, and even looked forward to it; talking to the staff, even becoming friends. The fact i felt so much better after leaving left a great association with the habit of going a couple times a week.
After treatment, my papers were directly presented to Mr Moore, and he helped me with my case in a very straight forward manner.
So between these two professionals, and their staffs, i felt very taken care of, and confident that i was more than a $ symbol with legs.
A++

name: Stephanie Vaughn
text: Dr. Douglas Kaul, his associates and the staff of the Mobile Chiropractic Associates are the best!  In just 2 weeks of treatment, I am moving more freely; sleeping soundly and feeling great!  Unfortunately, my back problem began to surface after a minor exercise routine, 2 years ago.  My husband suggested I find a chiropractor to see if that type of treatment would be helpful.  After checking reviews, calling several chiropractic offices and listening for a voice with a caring, understanding attitude, along with their ability to answer my questions, I found Mobile Chiropractic Associates.  Tonya, medical secretary/receptionist, took time to speak with me and answer my questions in a kind, courteous and unhurried manner.  I have received great care!  Dr. Douglas Kaul is very knowledgeable, is down to earth and doesn't pull punches. He shows and explains all he finds on the x-rays, which he takes himself.  He makes you feel comfortable; listens to your concerns regarding your treatment options and plan, answering any questions you may have.  Diane, his nurse, is very nice and engages you; always finding something to say to make you smile. As evidenced by the x-rays, my neck and lower back were slightly out of line and in that very first visit, I had an adjustment.  I didn't know what to expect during the process and Dr. Kaul explained everything and was gentle.  That day was the best I had ever felt in a long time and I am feeling even better, today! Dr. Kaul, his associates and staff have great compassion for every person who comes for help.   After your first visit, you will realize the care you receive is focused on getting you up and moving again, as pain free as possible.  Before you decide to give up; suffer through the pain; limit your activities and just take pain pills, epidurals or opt for surgery, find a well-qualified, caring, chiropractic physician.  I would like to suggest one such physician to you: Dr. Douglas Kaul at Mobile Chiropractic Associates.

name: Manay Clark
text: Dr. Thacker has been treating my menopause symptoms with bioidentical hormones for six years. These treatments have given my life back. My GI tract did not absorb oral hormone supplements. Consequently, I had problems associated with extremely low hormone levels: cognitive deficits, sleep disturbances, difficulty making decisions, migraine headaches, fatigue, bloating, reduced libido, and severe hot flashes. Dr. Thacker's program returned me to health. The treatment itself is not painful. Dr. Thacker is very gentle. And I can't say enough about the staff. I'm sure I've given them a few headaches, but they're always positive, cheerful, and accommodating.

name: Scott Gray
text:
Been to many pain centers. Dr T. is the only one, the only one ever to listen to me. I have been and had more pain free days in the last 60 then all the good days combined in 25 years. I am sold and happy

29 July 2016.

It has been a couple years now I have been seeing the Doc.  I am still very impressed and like most, am a more functional human being.  To not have to ask my wife to lift (she still does worry about my back because it will go out) something brought back some manhood to me.

name: Katie Southerland
text: The best doctor ever!! All the staff are exceptionally sweet and helpful. I've never felt better since I started here 1 year ago.  Thank you Dr.Thacker and all of the staff!! A++++

name: Joany Zilke
text:
I love & adore Dr. Thacker, Kelly, and the staff.

Chronic pain patients have been made to look like pariahs in society today because of the big opioid epidemic. Dr. Thacker will not make you feel like an addict, but will work on different areas of the body to help relieve the pain with the goal of getting you off narcotic pain meds if possible.

He & Kelly both can use dry needling (which is similar to acupuncture), and it is miraculous! It’s a wonderful feeling to go in with knots in your shoulders & come out relaxed and not carrying the weight of the world on them. Now, if I could just get them to do house calls 3x a week to do this..... well, I’m getting carried away. These wonderful people are now like an extension of my family, they care about their patients, and for that I’m grateful.

I know there are people out there that are just looking for a place that will give you drugs.... this isn’t the place.

name: Nathan
text: Dr Thacker literally saved my life!  He has helped me so much. His staff could improve on helpfulness and courtesy but he is a great dr!

name: Testing Home Remedies
text: Great place to go. I played soccer for 11yrs and it has taken its tole, after seeing Dr. Thacker and his nurse practitioner I can now perform my day to day activities pain free. Thank you Dr. Thacker and all your staff.  Very nice!!!

name: Lorraine Strobel
text:
It seemed like they like to prescribe narco to control pain more than using other methods. I never had a plan explained to me .how I would have my pain controlled. I had to suggest radio frequency ablation which when done gave me a bad cramp . I still have have that cramp 10 months later . I was told I got it because my core too weak.  I told him it hurt my knee to walk and was told to suck it up. I went to orthopedist and was told not to do the long walks that I have a baker cyst and torn meniscus and needed pt.
I am giving 3 stars only because at first he did do needling, etc. . Then it completely stopped for 11 months. Only told how I should use the narco 3x a day. I stopped taking it. I would rather not get addicted to it.

name: T Williams
text: Dr Thacker and Charlotte are AMAZING!! They get 5 stars!!! Have alot of Orthopedic issues and a Digestive disease problem and the treatment is working very well. My ankle was almost severed off years ago from a car wreck. 8 surgeries later and the pain never completely went away. Just lived with it. Dr. Thacker did an injection treatment on it today and it was a miracle. The pain is non existent at the moment and im not hobbling around in pain. I am feeling so much better ever since i started as a patient of his. He has an excellent bed side manner and cares what you have to say and listens to all your concerns and takes his time. The downfall is the nurses will rush him out of the room. If it was subtle and not noticicle it wouldnt be so bad. But its not. But Excellent Doctor, Excellent Practice and good people. If you're lucky enough to get the nurse Charlotte and Dr. Thacker together thats a blessing!! Charlotte listens and really cares what you have to say without interruptions and is very professional. Best nurse and doctor ive come across in 20 years. 5 STARS!!

name: Nora Lee
text: Dr. Thacker approached my  pain problem with an innovative, individualized treatment plan based on an accurate diagnosis. He was compassionate, persistent, and effective.

name: Tisha Johnson
text: Seems all these reviews praise Dr. T for the help he has given to them.  Is there anyone that has had a bad experience with him?  I'm at my current pain center and extremely unhappy, I'm repeatedly told I'm a liar after they have told me something and I have to pay extra to have a "comprehensive" visit just to discuss my medications.  I'm seeking a doctor that will actually listen to me and my problems which is many.  I have a doctor for just about every body system and every one of them actually listen to me as I know my body best.  They are proud to be treating me as many consider me a 'walking miracle' as I was in a coma and developed ARDS that 75% of people die from.  I should know, I live in it.  I've got to find a pain doctor that will listen to me and get this pain under control.  Currently I just the place I'm going to is just collecting my money without helping and I've been there 3 years in October!!!

name: Billy Ray
text: I am going to leave a completely honest review. This is my first visit. Front office staff was good. Dr. Thacker was great! Very thorough examination, felt confident with what he had to tell me. Was onboard with his plan, thought everything was going great. Then came the simple task of printing out prescriptions and leaving. The first set of prescriptions were incorrect, I thought ok life happens. Went back in let the receptionist know that the prescription was possibly printed out wrong. Nurse brought the Dr. out to "explain" the prescription to me. He "explained", left the reception area (really was a fan of having anything "explained" to me in the reception area especially by the Dr.) Nurse was then very adamant that the system is not wrong. I insisted, she resisted, but finally went back to check. I thought no harm, no foul, 10 minutes later the nurse comes out and hands me the "corrected" prescriptions. I said that I was sorry (wait what am I even sorry for) she said "that's ok". Make it to the elevator only to have them wrong AGAIN. I go back in let the receptionist know that maybe they printed out wrong again. The nurse comes out smirks, takes them back. A little quicker this time she comes out hands to me, "corrected" again. I get to the elevator and thinking noway they are wrong again, lo and behold, AGAIN. This by now had lost its "no harm, no foul" charm. I go back in she takes them back. I think of a possible issue with the prescriptions that the pharmacy may have. So, while she is about to make a copy of the prescriptions and has the Dr. sign it. I interuptered her and tried to mention the possible issue, only to be interrupted by what I gather is the nurse practioner to be told "that is what the system says, so it is what it is" tried couple more times to explain my concern to the point I was like just forget it. So, I am assuming that is the extent of my patient-Dr. relationship there, sadly. But, this is for anyone that may read this from this office. I suffer from severe depression and severe anxiety and no, not related to the pain (pain certainly doesn't help). I know you probably do not care but my world is practically falling apart. Now, pain has cost me my job and yea that stings for anyone but with the issues I suffer from I realize I am not capable of seeing the forest for the trees and decent coping skills. I was more than polite to everyone involved until my last encounter of being interrupted. But please remember people are not in your office because they want to be and for the love of God please understand that people have to deal with life's kicks outside of those walls of your office. Please just take the time to be kind with in reason. Thanks

name: Ladonice Waldrep-Neamtu
text: Dr. Thacker and his staff are very personable. I have been seeing Dr. Thacker for about four years. In that time Dr. Thacker has developed a very specialized approach to manage the pain I have due to an MVA. He has helped me find the light at the end of a very dark tunnel; through a balanced approach that includes the body, mind and spirit. I highly recommend Dr. Thacker to anyone that is experiencing an acute bout of pain or suffering from a chronic painful illness or injury.

name: Pamela CG
text: I've been going to Dr. Thacker for a few months now and have been feeling "iffy" about him since I started. The first day I walked in, he said he'd have me in "Olympic shape" in no time without even seeing what was wrong. I was paying him $100 a week to do therapies that ultimately didn't last more than a day for chronic back pain that I've been suffering for more than 7 years. Every week, he'd tell me something different that I'd need to do and would get aggravated at me because I couldn't afford to keep trying therapies that weren't working. But the kicker came when I finally started feeling a bit better by doing various exercises that helped me tolerate my constant pain better and I had an appointment where I was going to tell him I'd just delay the epidural shot we were planning. The night before, however, one of my boys started throwing up and had thrown up 5 times over the night and I had no choice but to cancel my appointment. I told them there was really no need for me to reschedule at the moment, that I was doing somewhat better and wanted to see how my body handled the new exercise. They said they'd have to charge me a $25 fee for an "unacceptable cancelation". Are you kidding me? How am I supposed to be able to control when my kids get sick? I'd been considering switching doctors to begin with because I didn't feel like he was meeting my needs, but that sealed it. So what about the almost 2 hours that I sat in the waiting room on my first visit past my appointment time? What about the time I've lost waiting for late appointments? Who's going to compensate me for that? I'm disgusted that I've spent so much money on them for nothing other than to have them pretty much spit in my face when I had a sick kid.

name: Lisa Lewis
text: My husband is a patient of Dr Thackers and I could not be more pleased. Dr. T suggested alternative ways to help my husband with his chronic pain such as excersize, acupuncture, and he gave him a list of books to read on his diagnosis as well as his pain medicine. I don't like when someone suggest that a Dr is not caring or is not doing his job simply b/c he writes a prescription for a Narcotic  pain medication. It could be b/c he is empathetic, he truly cares about his patients and fellow man and does not want to anyone suffer needlessly. There is an epidemic raging thru our society and I can understand the pause physician give before writing anyone any type of pain medication. That's why we need Drs like Dr. Thacker who can understand the law and know exactly how to help his patients. I for one applaud him and his very professional and discreet staff.

name: Roger “RPP” Pittman
text:
Hey everybody my name is ROGER & I'm a Cancer patient, I had stage 3 brain Cancer I went to Birmingham for surgery.. I'm so thankful for surviving although wen I left the hospital I had 89 staples n my head, but I was still pretty.lol
I have to go to CCI every 6mths for MRI bcuz I have 2 brain tumors on the main muscle of my left eye which my Cancer doc told me I will go blind in that eye eventually, since surgery I'm on Disability since I was 30yrs old can't drive bcuz I'm also a seizure patient but my memory is so bad I'm so embarrassed by it.
I try to live my life bcuz of my kids which I wld die for them, I go to Dr. Thacker every month bcuz I have chronic pain for over 12-15yrs..
With my brain tumors, 3 herniated disc n my neck, 3 bulging disc & degenerate disc disease n my back... Dr. Thacker to me is awesome!, we're r still working on the rite pain medication rite now but trust me I've been to enough pain docs but all they care about is money... I'm relieved thou that Dr. Thacker is getting better after his surgery bcuz no matter what all these negative patients say he's one HELL of a Doctor Who really cares about his patients, the nurses who cares if they talk about other patients they have every rite to it's not against the law that they Gossip...
So no matter what I'm very proud & THANKFUL for Dr. Thacker...

name: Jennifer “Jenn” Swoards
text: I have been seeing Dr. Thacker since May 2014. I was permanently disabled for over 3 years at that point. I was also only 32 years old. I couldn't walk, couldn't sit and definitely couldn't work. I have 2 young girls. I felt helpless. I moved from PA to AL in 2010 and had nothing but horrible experienced with the doctors down here. Seems all I was finding were ones that just wanted more money for less time and constantly being misdiagnosed. So badly I had to have an emergency Splenectomy because of a tumor that had grown in my spleen overtaking it. The kicker is Huntsville Hospital found it in 2010 and never told me. Needless to say I almost died.   That terrified me. I  didn't even want to seek medical care because of what I had already experienced. This left me in an enormous amount of pain. I found HPM in April 14' and read up on Doc and got a referral. Doc saved my life. He listened to me, evaluated me and not o lay gave me medication but did needle treatment. I went home crying. It was the first time I could touch my feet in years. My muscle was that bad around my L5 area. Within 6 months I was off disability and working at NASA. Finally able to lead a normal life. He cares. He doesn't force anything you don't want. He knew at one point I didn't have insurance so he didn't push extra things on me that cost money. He cared more about if I was ok. He's met my girls and my husband and I introduce him as the man who saved me. Yeah maybe there have been some iffy staff over the years but let me go on and tell ya they get in everywhere. Doc and his staff has done an amazing job at weeding them outa d keeping the ones that do a great job. He doesn't even like to Hear that someone was treated unfairly. He will fix it. And anyone that says he didn't help. They were only there for one thing. And he is not a pill pusher. But I could name 3 other places in Huntsville that are and maybe you should go there.

name: Inigo Montoya
text: Read my review all the way through to understand my 2 stars even though I love Dr T!  He has made such a difference in my life!  I can function day to day with my kids and do the things I need to do to be mom and a productive citizen!  Most pain clinics in our area have stopped any daily medications after the fall of Dr. Aggarwal, and unfortunately this affects the lives of many people.  Before I came to Dr Thacker, my pain management doctor was doing procedure after procedure and collecting that insurance money and my surgical copay month after month.  I could not get out of bed in the mornings.  I came to Dr Thacker and he not only got me on a daily pain medication regiment, but he also a total body workup and found vitamin and mineral levels along with hormones out of whack and gave me suggestions on what supplements to add and how much, and I have never felt this well before!  I wake up every morning close to pain free (compared to where I was before he came into my life) and energized!  He is open to alternative therapies like dry needling (like acupuncture) and other less conventional treatments like chiropractic and massage.  I love all of the nurses, they're all so sweet.  There's one young lady at the window, Wendy, Lindy, Lindsey, or Penny, (I can never catch her name but it sounds like one of those) she wears glasses and has long hair that has some curl to it.  She is so precious.  The other girl at the window has never mentioned her name, but she's skinny and her hair has been up the times I've seen her.  I don't care for her.  She's very cold and unwelcoming, and she only does the bare minimum to get buy.  Don't expect her to go out of her way for you on anything.  She's also on her personal phone every time I sign in.  The lady that did  my drug test at my first appointment, Shari was her name, is also rude.  I've been in an exam room and overheard her and skinny receptionist gossiping about a patient talking about they don't think he had a legitimate pain and he just comes through for medication.  The truthfulness of that doesn't matter, but that is between the doctor and the patient, not a sub par receptionist and a lady who plays with urine all day.  It's a shame I have to rate Dr T so low because of these two nitwhits, but they're the face of his practice.  If he hadn't made such an improvement to my life, I would find another clinic.

name: Michael Little
text: Dr. Thacker and staff are great!!! Dr. Thacker cares for the people he sees!!!!

name: Christopher Loftin
text: Dr Thacker and staff are great.

name: Joseph Clem
text: They are miracle workers!

name: Dawn Armstrong
text:
They're discriminating against people with Medicare and they talk politics in front of patients.
The staff is very unprofessional!

name: Tracy Evers
text: So thankful for this awesome chiropractor and staff! Got me in while on vacation when I was in need of an adjustment. I feel so much better. May have to drive down just to see them!

name: Nancy Litch
text: Excellent doctor who also does acupuncture. I highly recommend this practice. The off staff are very friendly and competent too.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Nancy.

name: Pamela Morton
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful right from the first phone call. Dr. Gravely asked questions about my chiropractic care "up north" and was able to gently get me readjusted. Atmosphere was relaxing. Highly recommend.

name: Jeannie Reece
text:
Very warm atmosphere.
And great staff

name: Jim Puckett
text: Even though I told them this was a one time visit as I am from out of state, they started a new patient folder. I was treated but when I asked for his diagnosis and treatment I was told he hadn't written it up. I had my home Dr. Request those records, which I signed off for, but they have not sent them. I was charged for new patient records on that date before my insurance was even contacted. Not happy with this lack of professionalism.

name: Jason Reynolds
text: One slip is all it takes. After a long drive in for a week of vacationing in Orange Beach. I believe part muscle and part alignment became my problem. Gravely got me in quickly. He responded to my email inquiry after hours. He listened to my history and got me straightened out. Thanks! Without this I would not have been able to enjoy the week.

name: Katrina Menzies
text: Love this place.... acupuncture!!

name: Tina Nelson
text: Always makes me feel so much better!!

name: Karen
text: As a winter visitor I was looking for a really good therapeutic massage to soothe my aching back and legs.  I had an appointment at the chiropractic clinic with Audra, who was fantastic.  She really gave my aches a workout which was what I wanted and needed.  The room and massage table were comfortable and the price was perfect for my budget.  The doctor's office was convenient to where I was staying, has a nice parking lot, and is easy to find.  The other people working here were also very friendly.  I wish I had found this massage opportunity sooner, but now have the number saved to my phone for my visit next winter.

name: Tangerine Tundra AG
text: Dr. Gravely was very gentle and great with kids.

name: Melissa Brendtro
text: Easy in and out, great adjustments.

name: Ann McFadden
text: Dr. Steven is awesome

resp.text: Thanks, Ann. I appreciate the kind words.

name: Jacob Kayl, Jr.
text: Wonderful chiropractor and massage therapist

name: Saadiyah Smith
text: This was my first time meeting with this pain management specialist. He and his staff are super fast very clean very compliant due to covid . They make you feel very comfortable and the atmosphere is comforting . He himself is very cheery , you would think someone who is looking mainly at complaining or persons very sick has a very bright and sunny innerG. We did some talking and I will inform you of our Dr patient results as he months ensue. But if you are looking for an excellent pain center I would start here first . Thank you Dr for making me comfortable.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words!

name: linda cardwell
text: Very nice and friendly staff. The doc is very concerned and sees to your needs. I would highly recommend this place

resp.text: Many Thanks Linda! Blessings this season... Merry Christmas to you and your family! We’ll be here if you need us. Dr. P

name: Judy Larkins
text: Dr. Pitkanen treated me twice before he opened his own practice, and I obtained positive outcomes both times.  He is one of the kindest and most caring doctors I have ever seen.  Different treatments do not work for everyone.  But, in my opinion, he will do his best to help you feel like a worthwhile individual who deserves the best care available and apply his knowledge to help you feel as pain free as possible.

resp.text: Thanks Mrs. Larkins! Have a great day!

name: Betty Brown
text: Dr. Pitkanen is a very caring doctor. I have been in various degrees of pain for 4 years. I desire to be able to enjoy life with my family. I have had to give up many activities because of pain. Dr. Pitkanen has offered me hope of enjoyment of life again. He listens and is so nice as is his staff. They just make me feel better every time I see or talk to any of them.

resp.text: Many thanks Mrs. Brown--our privilege to take care of you! We will get there together! Have a great day, and again thanks.

name: Angela Green
text: The Dr.Is so patient and caring.He really cares about your pain.I had a procedure on my back on yesterday and I can feel it’s already  better .Thank you Dr.P.If your looking for a good Christian physician he’s your guy.The office staff  are so friendly and kind.The office is so peaceful and clean.Great place.I give it a 5 stars ⭐️thank you all.

resp.text: Alright Angela! Praise the Lord! Thanks so much for letting us take care of you and have a great weekend!

name: Victor H Smallfield
text: Excellent practice. I have chronic pain and they help me manage it. NP Edwards is excellent and Dr. Pitkanen is one of the kindest and nicest people I ever met. And the rest of the staff are pretty awesome too. The building can be a bit challenging to navigate at first, that's my only complaint.

resp.text: Thanks so much Mr. Smallfield!

name: Donna Morgan
text: Dr. Pitkanen and his incredible staff are truly a compassionate team. Words are not enough to explain how caring and concerned they are about your journey.  Thank you for always going the extra mile!

resp.text: Thanks Mrs. Morgan! Blessings during this season!

name: Debbie J
text: Dr Pitkanen is great! He seems to genuinely care about his patients. The staff are very friendly. The office was clean. Handicapped parking is available. All in all it was a great experience.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Debbie! Have a great day!
